summary: [Staging][Dashboard][List Widget] When a list with a scroll bar is changed to a list that should have no scroll bar, the scroll bar is not removed
description:
*Environment:*
[https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link] 

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a List Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + button, add Value source _Employees_
# Click on the Value > Data
# Drag a _Employee Name_ attribute into an empty column
# Click Apply
#* This will result to a list with a scroll bar (has more than 20 records)
# In the Widget, click meatballs menu > Settings
# Click Employee Data > Drag a new attribute to an empty column (_Employment Status_)
# Filter Employee Status to Inactive
#* This will result to a list with 5 rows only (no scroll bar)
# Click Apply

*Expected Result:*
List is short, no need for a scroll bar

*Actual Result:*
A scroll bar appears, causing infinite scrolling when scrolled down

!Recording 2024-04-26 194116.mp4|width=2560,height=1390,alt="Recording 2024-04-26 194116.mp4"!

summary: [Staging][Dashboard][List Widget] List does not "go to top" when adding a new column then cancelling
description:
*Environment:*
[https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link] 

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a List Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + button, add Value source _Employees_
# Click on the Value > Data
# Drag a _Employee Name_ attribute into an empty column
# Click Apply
# In the Widget, scroll down so that 200 records appear (basically “2 sets” of data)
# In the Widget, click meatballs menu > Settings
# Click Employee Data > Drag a new attribute to an empty column (_Employment Status_)
# Click Cancel
# In the Widget, check list results

*Expected Result:*
Top of the list is shown

*Actual Result:*
No scrolling up, only the first 100 records are displayed

*Related to (see the comment here):*
[https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-8111?focusedCommentId=48726|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-8111?focusedCommentId=48726|smart-link]

summary: [Staging][Dashboard][Numeric Widget] Checkbox options keep reloading for filters with multiple pages of results
description:
*Environment:*
[https://staging.knitware.com/dashboard/|https://staging.knitware.com/dashboard/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _Tickets_
# Click + in Value > _Tickets_
# Click _Tickets_ > Filter
# Select _Type_ (this is a filter with multiple pages of results - from an API)
# Click on a checkbox

*Expected Result:*
Checkbox is checked

*Actual Result:*
Checkbox is checked, but the options are “reloaded”

This becomes significant when the user is on the 2nd / 3rd page of the results, when the options reload, the user has to scroll down multiple times again
Please make sure there will  be no regressions to the lazy loading of filter results

summary: [STAGING][Dashboard][List Widget] - Task Duration Column not filtered properly
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

The filtered Task Duration is not displaying what’s expected.

When the column is filterd with a either min or max value only, an unexpected 'taskDuration_Lte: “NaN” ' or   'taskDuration_Gte: “NaN” ' is passed in the payload.

i.e. when min only, the payload is

{noformat}query getListWidget($offset: Int) {
  PumAuJELEsOnHrg: tasks(
    orderBy: "id"
    offset: $offset
    limit: 100
    taskDuration_Gte: "3600"
    taskDuration_Lte: "NaN"
  ) {
    items {
      taskDuration
      __typename
    }
    totalItemsCount
    __typename
  }
}{noformat}

Actual:

!image-20240424-072607.png|width=1885,height=694,alt="image-20240424-072607.png"!

3 rows



Expected:

However if you do not include the NaN, there are more results

!image-20240424-072257.png|width=1471,height=955,alt="image-20240424-072257.png"!



Additionally, if you put the minimum (3600) and maximum (7730941129200) possible values in both Gte and Lte parameters, only 2 are returned

!image-20240424-073053.png|width=1534,height=776,alt="image-20240424-073053.png"!



h2. *Root Cause*

*Possibly becasue taskDuration is defined as a String in the df schema

summary: [STAGING][HRHUB][Regularization Date] Fix the Regularization Date Field
description:
*Steps to Replicate:*

# Go to Employee Records
# Select the HR Record tab
# Go to the Hiring Information Section
# Click the Regularization Date Field
# Select a date for Regularization
# Click Save Changes
# Log out
# Login to your admin account
# Go to Employee Records
# Click the Data Changes button
# Select the For Approval Tab

*Expected*

The Regularization Date Change should be there

*Actual*

The Regularization Date Change Request is not there.

*Additional Info:*

* Right now the Regularization Date is being auto computed from the Company Hire Date. Backend automatically adds 180 days from the Company Hire Date. And then Backend/Frontend doesn’t recognize the inputted Regularization Date in the field.
* The + 180 days logic is just supposed to be the default

description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Chart Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Go to Chart Tab > Chart Type > Select Pie
# Go back to “Data” Tab
# Click + in Value > _Employees_
# Click + in Parameters > _Custom Dates_
# Click Custom Dates Parameter > Change Display to Yearly
# Change Date range to include an earlier year (can set “From” as “12/31/2022”)
# Inspect the “series” colors for the years 2022, 2023, 2024

*Expected Result:*
All Series colors should be unique by default

*Actual Result:*
Year 2023 and Year 2024 have the same color

*Notes:*
Issue not limited to Pie charts, can also affect Polar/Line/Bar. See below for video recordings

summary: [DEV][Dashboard][List Widget] - Some columns with number and date data types have a checkbox filter
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

If a column is a date type, its filter should be a To/From data picker.

!image-20240410-100008.png|width=282,height=184,alt="image-20240410-100008.png"!

If a column is a number type, its filter should be a min/max picker.

!image-20240410-100040.png|width=194,height=166,alt="image-20240410-100040.png"!

However, there are some columns that mistakenly have the checkbox UI for its filter even if their data type is date or number.

The following is a list of those columns

HR Hub

* Attendances
** Number
*** Absent (Hours)
*** Undertime (hours)
*** Late (hours)
*** Overbreak (hours)
*** Night Differential (hours)
*** Offset (hours)
*** Overtime (Hours)
*** Actual (hours)
*** Scheduled Hours
** Date
*** Absent Date
*** Undertime (date)
*** Late (date)
*** Overbreak (date)
*** Night Differential (date)
*** Offset (date)
*** Leave Date
*** Overtime (Date)
*** Scheduled Date

Projects

* Task
** Number
*** Time Spent
*** Duration

user: [rand.01@mailinator.com|mailto:rand.01@mailinator.com] // rand.01!
admin user: [qaAdmin@mailinator.com|mailto:qaAdmin@mailinator.com] // qaAdmin1!

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the x module

summary: [Dev][Staging][Dashboard][Chart Widget] Date Type filter not sending the correct Dates when the GraphQL field is a "Date" type instead of "DateTime" type
description:
*Environment:*
[https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Chart Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click _+ > Requests_
# Click on + in parameter > Request Date
# Enter in Date Range
## From: 10/01/2023
## To: 10/07/2023
## Display: Weekly
# Check GraphQL

*Expected Result:*

{noformat}{"operationName":"getChartWidget","variables":{},"query":"query getChartWidget {\n
  TXgrqxKuYfHAvLIkYCwT: requests(\n
    orderBy: \"id\"\n
    offset: 0\n
    limit: 0\n
    startDate_Gte: \"2023-10-01\"\n         -> FROM
    endDate_Lte: \"2023-10-07\"\n           -> TO
    function: [\"count\", \"requestType\"]\n
  ) {\n
    totalItemsCount\n
    functionResponse\n
    __typename\n
  }\n
}"}{noformat}

*Actual Result:*

{noformat}{"operationName":"getChartWidget","variables":{},"query":"query getChartWidget {\n
  TXgrqxKuYfHAvLIkYCwT: requests(\n
    orderBy: \"id\"\n
    offset: 0\n
    limit: 0\n
    startDate_Gte: \"2023-10-01\"\n
    endDate_Lte: \"2023-10-08\"\n                 -> always has + 1 day when comapred to the "To" value
    function: [\"count\", \"requestType\"]\n
  ) {\n
    totalItemsCount\n
    functionResponse\n
    __typename\n
  }\n
}"}{noformat}

*Notes:*

# Root cause of the issue might be because for Date Range filter we usually put the “To” value as  end of day “2023-10-07*T23:59:59.999Z*”
However, for the case of “Request Date” it is mapped to a Date field (instead of DateTime field). Maybe some rounding is happening which causes the To value to be come the next day.
# When fixing this issue, please make sure that DateTime fields are not affected (should still use end of day)

!2024-04-01 19_43_39-Knit.png|width=1920,height=1043,alt="2024-04-01 19_43_39-Knit.png"!

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][List Widget] Date format incorrect for a few options
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a List Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + button, add Value source _Employees_
# Click on the Value > Data
# Drag _Birthdate_ to an empty column
# Go to Appearance tab > Column Format > select Birthdate in drop down
# Check formatting for:
## M/D/YY
## D/M/YY
## YY/M/D
## D Month, Yr

*Expected Result:*
Date is transformed to the selected format

*Actual Result:*
Formatting and results do not match

Given: November 08, 2022

These mismatch are all related to YY vs 2022
either we change to {{YY to YYYY}} or change {{2022 to 22}}

# M/D/YY → 11/8/2022
# D/M/YY → 8/11/2022
# YY/M/D → 2022/11/8


For this case, Month is abbreviated, December to Dec
either we change to {{Month to Mon}} or change {{Dec to December}}

# D Month, Yr → 8 Dec, 2024

[Dev][Dashboard][List Widget] Change how filter for Date and Number works
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]



*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a List Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + button, add Value source _Absences_
# Click on the Value > Data
# Drag _Absent Date_ and _Absent (Hours)_ to empty columns
# In the added columns click the kebab menu > Filter



*Problem:*
Currently the date / number type filter seems to be from the Chart Widget.

It would be better to base it on the Number Widget due to the following issues:

# Filters should be “blank” by default
## Blank “From” and “To” Date
## For “Min” and “Max” the default is 0 for both
# There is no capability to “Clear” the fields
## If you enter an incorrect value, there is no way to clear the filter for Numbers
# For numbers, we cannot use “Gte” or “Lte” only, they must always be used together
## Can be I problem if for example I want Salary > 50,000 (cannot do this since the filter always applies an Lte filter as well)

Issue: Assigned to field loads assignees slowly

!image-20240327-035617.png|width=2611,height=1845,alt="image-20240327-035617.png"!

Steps to replicate:

# Log in to knit
# Open an existing project with tasks and assignees

Expected: Tasks and assignees will appear immediately within 2 minutes

Actual: It slowly loads the assignees

summary: Prod | Projects | Selecting a name in the Assigned To field is slow and shows something wrong error message
description:
Issue: Selecting a name in the Assigned To field is slow and shows something wrong error message

See attached video, which is a portion of the loading time before the results appeared

Steps to replicate:

# Log in to knit
# Create a project or open an existing project with tasks
# On any task, click Assigned to + and enter a name, ex. Ericson

Expected: Search results will appear immediately within 2 minutes

Actual: Something went wrong error message appeared and it slowly loads the results

summary: Prod | Chat | Add to Favorites popup - messages exceed the max length and Add button is pushed far right
description:
Issue: Add to Favorites popup - messages exceed the max length and Add button is pushed far right

!image-20240327-032810.png|width=1692,height=875,alt="image-20240327-032810.png"!

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit
# Go to Chat
# Click Add to Favorites
# Scroll down to chat conversations showing long messages

Expected: The same max width is followed so elements of Add button are aligned

Actual. Add button can no longer be seen in the popup

summary: Prod | Chat Recipient's field selection - Selected name jumps on top of list
description:
Issue: When you select a name on the chat message recipient’s box search results, it jumps to the top of the dropdown list instead of being retained in the same order.

See attached video.



Steps to Replicate:

Log in to Knit

Go to Chat

Click New Chat

On the recipient’s list, select a name that is not on the search results' top 1 name. 



Expected: The name will be selected and will retain its order in the dropdown list.

Actual: The selected name is shown on top of the list.

summary: Prod | Chat | Recipient of message - Search results are loaded slowly, not fully loading available names
description:
Issue: When you enter a name on the chat message recipient’s box, it doesn’t load the results or it will load but won’t show you the full list of available persons, ex. Mark was entered but Mark Ivan’s name is not shown

See attached video.



Steps to Replicate:

Log in to Knit

Go to Chat

Click New Chat

Enter a name, ex. Amze or Mark

Expected: Amze or Mark Ivan’s names will appear on the search results

Actual: Nothing is loaded when you search Amze. Mark Ivan’s name doesn’t appear in the search results

summary: Projects | Task Slider left even after deleting the subtask, Parent task got deleted, too
description:
Issue: Deleted task still retained its task details

!image-20240326-112849.png|width=1229,height=836,alt="image-20240326-112849.png"!

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit
# Go to Projects
# Add a task with subtask
# On the List view, hover on the subtask and click the 3-dots icon 
# Click Move to Trash

Expected: The subtask will be deleted and its task details won’t be shown.

Actual: The subtask and parent task were deleted. The Subtask’s slider, was still showing up even if it was already deleted.

summary: [Dev | Stg][Dashboard][List Widget] Error appears after adding 4 columns then creating the widget
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a List Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _Tickets_
# Click + button, add Value source _Tickets_
# Click on the Value > Data
# Drag _Title, Created By,_ and _Created At_ to empty columns
# Click “Apply” 
#* At this point no error is shown yet
# Click the meatball menu of the List Widget > Settings
# Add a fourth column _Resolved At_
# Click “Apply” 

*Expected Result:*
Four columns are now shown

*Actual Result:*
Four columns are shown, but an error is displayed

{noformat}Message: Request failed with status code 400
Name: AxiosError Code: ERR_BAD_REQUEST
Config: [object Object]
Request: [object XMLHttpRequest]
Response: [object Object]{noformat}

!Recording 2024-03-26 180426.mp4|width=2008,height=1386,alt="Recording 2024-03-26 180426.mp4"!





Also, if you scroll down the list, you will only see the first 100 records again

!failwhen3.2.png|width=1510,height=1010,alt="failwhen3.2.png"!

And if you refresh the page, the 4th column will disappear

!failwhen3.3.png|width=1514,height=1043,alt="failwhen3.3.png"!

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][List Widget] Date Period not applicable for Values that get data from "attendances"
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Background:*
We have a “Date Period” filter functionality for List Widget
Entering a “From” and “To” adds this to the GraphQL query:

{noformat}createdAt_Gte: "2024-02-01T00:00:00.000Z"
createdAt_Lte: "2024-03-01T00:00:00.000Z"{noformat}

*Problem:*
The {{attendances}} GraphQL does not have {{createdAt_Gte}} / {{createdAt_Lte}} filter parameters

!2024-03-26 15_25_20-HR Hub _ attendances - My Workspace.png|width=1829,height=1044,alt="2024-03-26 15_25_20-HR Hub _ attendances - My Workspace.png"!

summary: Tickets | Submit Ticket - Inappropriate mascot for confirming ticket submission
description:
Environment: Dev

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit
# Submit a ticket to a queue
# Observe the popup of confirmation message

{noformat}{"operationName":"getListWidget","variables":{"offset":0},"query":"query getListWidget($offset: Int) {\n

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][List Widget] Date Type and Number Type columns immediately have a filter applied
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a List Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + button, add Value source _Employees_
# Click on the Value > Data
# Drag the following columns
## Hire Date
## Regularization Date
## Age
## Separation Date

*Expected Result:*
Columns are added to the list

*Actual Result:*
Columns are added to the list, but all the rows disappear

*Notes:*
These are all Number and Date type columns, it looks like a filter is being applied by default



*Number Type:*
Seems incorrect because it is passing Gte: 100, Lte: 99. This can never return results.

{noformat}{"operationName":"getListWidget","variables":{"offset":0},"query":"query getListWidget($offset: Int) {\n
  lveHNEbAUsmFOWf: employees(\n
    orderBy: \"id\"\n
    offset: $offset\n
    limit: 100\n
    age_Gte: 100\n
    age_Lte: 99\n
  ) {\n
    items {\n
      age\n
      __typename\n
    }\n
    totalItemsCount\n
    __typename\n
  }\n
}"}{noformat}

*Data Type:*

# Seems to be returning Week Start until current day be default
# Filter has a mismatch with what is displayed in the UI (shows 6months ago until today, but graphQL is weekstart until currentdate)
# Filter UI seems to also have been reused from Charts, but should only have “From” and “To” (no Display)

{noformat}{"operationName":"getListWidget","variables":{"offset":0},"query":"query getListWidget($offset: Int) {\n
  wKmpHYuOViXvpdm: employees(\n
    orderBy: \"id\"\n
    offset: $offset\n
    limit: 100\n
    companyHireDate_Gte: \"2024-03-17T00:00:00.000Z\"\n
    companyHireDate_Lte: \"2024-03-19T23:59:59.999Z\"\n
  ) {\n
    items {\n
      companyHireDate\n
      __typename\n
    }\n
    totalItemsCount\n
    __typename\n
  }\n
}"}{noformat}

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Leaves] - The wrong UI is opened when editing a leave request
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

When editing a leave request, only the first opened leave’s UI is used when other leaves are opened for editing.



For example:

The user has pending sick and vacation leaves. The user wants to edit bothe, so he opens the VL first. The request modal is opened with the title ‘Vacation Leave’ and the details are shown. Next, the user edits the SL. When he clicks on the edit button, the modal is opened but the title is still ‘Vacation Leave’ instead of the expected ‘Sick Leave’. The date is correct but the reasons now only have VL values.



Until the user force reloads the page, only the VL UI is opened. If they then reload the page and edit the SL first, then only the SL UI will if they edit the VL request.

Actual:

!chrome_a7poRrIL0o.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!

Expected:

The relevant UI is opened per leave type

Credentials
user: [rand.01@mailinator.com|mailto:rand.01@mailinator.com] // rand.01!
admin user: [qaAdmin@mailinator.com|mailto:qaAdmin@mailinator.com] // qaAdmin1!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Leaves] - Filters reset when a leave is submitted
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

Users may filter their leave requests page to show only leaves that may be relevant for the moment. For example, they want to track pending leaves within a time period.

Currently however, whenever the user has filtered the leaves (either date or status), after submitting a new request, the filter is reset.

Actual:

!chrome_E6BAVphUwb.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!

In this example, the filter is for pending only. After the request is submitted, the leaves refresh and all other leaves are shown. Looking at the filter, only pending is checked but it does not work.

Next is a similar issue, but with the date filtered instead.

!chrome_kNvOG1hC1h.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!



This may be caused by the update to the leaves list in order to show the new request immediately. But if all the other leaves are then immediately shown, then the new request might get buried in the next pages.

Expected:

The filter should be retained when a leave is submitted



Credentials
user: [rand.01@mailinator.com|mailto:rand.01@mailinator.com] // rand.01!
admin user: [qaAdmin@mailinator.com|mailto:qaAdmin@mailinator.com] // qaAdmin1!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the HR Hub module > My Leave
# Filter the leaves by status and/or by date
# submit a new leave request

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Payroll] - Unpaid leaves are not deducted from net pay
description:
Dev environment.



User (Bruno Madrigal, employeeId 103) has perfect attendance for the month of February 2024 with 1 paid leave in the first half of February, and 1 unpaid leave in the second half of February.

!image-20240314-070918.png|width=1670,height=167!



Payroll is then generated for this employee for the two halves of February (Feb 1-15 2024 and Feb 16-29 2024): 1540, 1541.

Summary and attendance details can be seen in this [payroll report|https://sourcefitph.sharepoint.com/:x:/s/sharepointdevelopment/EUdD8R1-M89LnF28vsjejlAB_m328aNa__M8F4EEnHEVPQ?e=Ophtua].



!image-20240314-071041.png|width=91.66666666666666%!

Seen here is the net pay for the two payrolls. The only difference is one has paid leave, and the other has unpaid leave. No absences, late or undertime. 

Since one has unpaid leave, one netpay should be less than the other (as an unpaid leave is basically an absence), but the netpay for both is the same.

As there is no deduction of unpaid leave, the amount deducted cannot be verified also.

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Payroll] - Incorrect calculations for Absences, Lates and Undertime in the payroll
description:
Dev environent.



Test data was created for employees Benjamin Button (employeeID: 36) and Harry Potter (employeeID: 56) in the form of time adjusted attendances.

The range of the payroll created is Feb 1-15 2024 and Feb 16-29 2024 (Semi Monthly Payroll) for both users. The payroll can be found in the django admin (hr hub dev) with IDs 1535, 1536, 1537, and 1538.

Full details of the payroll and attendances can be found in this [payroll report|https://sourcefitph.sharepoint.com/:x:/s/sharepointdevelopment/EbHc7aR197pHks03lk7rKMwBlGTn-Phn7w_H7LN-Yf8b0Q?e=YAfRTa].



In summary, the absences, lates and undertime deductions calculated are incorrect. Here is a screenshot of the data from the excel report. Highlighted red are incorrect values.

!image-20240314-051055.png|width=375,height=263!

Below the highlighted cells are their expeected values from the formulas defined in this [sample payroll computation|https://sourcefitph.sharepoint.com/:x:/s/sharepointdevelopment/ESKQYO2OrvhDlA1m-fjMzcABZ33TUhQ66NAEnyAq1eKaQA?e=R22v71].



For example, employeeeId 36 has 1 absence in the Feb 1-15 range. 

!image-20240314-051538.png|width=1913,height=1034!

*The full february attendance is also included in the payroll report for each employee used. 

With a set monthly salary of 50,000.00 (set in the hr hub django admin > employees), the per day rate is 2,298.85, therefore the absences should also have a value of 2,298.85.

In the report (top row of screenshot is for 36 for Feb 1-15), the actual value is 22988.51.  This may look like the calculation is just off by a factor of 10, but if you look at other absences values, this is not the case.



For lates and undertimes, they were calculated by getting the respective values from the /attendance api and converting to hours (original is in seconds) then multiplying by the perHour value.  The actual values from the testdata ara also incorrect. Please review the payroll report excel.



CC: [~accountid:61d2597cce3652006aa3eb5d]

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Numeric Widget] "Tickets|Tickets|Reported/Requested by" filter is sending String type
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

I think this is a regression, this was working correctly before.



*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _Tickets_
# Click _+ > Tickets_
# Click on _Tickets_ > Filter > Reported/Requested by
# Click on an option

*Expected Result:*

{{createdBy_In}} passes integer type data

{noformat}{"operationName":"getNumberWidget","variables":{},"query":"query getNumberWidget {\n
  bmnrFAGpwvPGjAb: tickets(\n
    orderBy: \"id\"\n
    offset: 0\n
    limit: 0\n
    createdBy_In: [101]\n
    function: [\"count\", \"id\"]\n
  ) {\n
    totalItemsCount\n
    functionResponse\n
    __typename\n
  }\n
}"}{noformat}

*Actual Result:*

{{createdBy_In}} passes string type data

{noformat}{"operationName":"getNumberWidget","variables":{},"query":"query getNumberWidget {\n
  bmnrFAGpwvPGjAb: tickets(\n
    orderBy: \"id\"\n
    offset: 0\n
    limit: 0\n
    createdBy_In: [\"101\"]\n                  -> "101" instead of 101
    function: [\"count\", \"id\"]\n
  ) {\n
    totalItemsCount\n
    functionResponse\n
    __typename\n
  }\n
}"}{noformat}



{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Please fix for both *Numeric* and *Chart* Widgets
{panel}

summary: [PROD][Desktop][Projects] - Cannot delete a project with a task that has a subtask
description:
URL: [https://sourcefit.knitware.com/|https://sourcefit.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (knitware prod site)

Description:

Users can normally delete a project that they created.

If the project has contents (i.e. tasks, details, attachments), then the contents should be deleted along with the project.

Currently however, if the project contains a task that has a subtask, the project cannot be created.

!chrome_vRsjzPYHdZ.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!

An internal server error occurs if you try to delete the project. No error message is shown to the user, only in the console. The only indication that something might be wrong is that the delete button is stuck as ‘loading’

!image-20240311-040225.png|width=590,height=100!

!image-20240311-040238.png|width=604,height=405!



If the project only has tasks, it can be deleted

!chrome_xN2wEQVLeM.mp4|width=1920,height=1080!



Additionally, even if you delete the tasks and subtasks, the project can’t be deleted still.

!chrome_pErUCdNNYa.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!



Credentials
please use your own credentials.

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login.
# Open the Projects module
# Create a project
# Go to the list view
# Create a task
# Open the task
# Create a subtask under the opened task
# Go to the projects landing page
# Delete the created project

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Numeric Widget][Regression] Formula spacing and validation messages UI issues
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

{panel:bgColor=#ffebe6}
Regression issues
{panel}

*Scenario 1: Invalid Operation*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + > _Employees_
# Click on Employees > Operator > Max

*Expected Result:*
An error appears in red font and red background
”This operation is not applicable to the selected value. Please select another operator.”

*Actual Result:*
Error appears but the red background is now white

!iSS2.1.png|width=2175,height=953!

* This also affects Charts, but the error implementation is probably generic

!iSS2.2.png|width=1190,height=1046!





*Scenario 2: Formulas*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + > _Employees_
# Go to Formula Tab
# Add different elements to the Formula (add them also such that they are mathematically invalid)

*Expected Result:*

# An error appears in red font and red background: There's a problem with your formula. The evaluation will result in an error.
# There is only a little spacing in between the elements of the formula bar


*Actual Result:*

# The validation error background is now white instead of red
# The spacing between the elements of the formula bar have increased

!iSS1.png|width=2625,height=954!

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Chart Widget] Incorrect and missing Default Operators for some Values in HR Hub Module
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]


Some Values for Charts do not have a “Default Operator” selected or some have an incorrect default operator selected

This was filed previously in Numeric widgets, I am just creating a new singular Jira for Charts

# [https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-8328|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-8328|smart-link] 
# [https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-8330|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-8330|smart-link]

#*# Leaves
#*# Leave Credits

#*# Salary

*Actual Result:*

# Actual Hours → Count
# Salary → Count

summary: Prod | Weaves | Cannot save date value at first on existing rows
description:
Issue: On the existing weave and rows, date value is not saved. You have to click Add row, add a date on that row then go back to existing rows and save the date to show up.

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit
# Go to Weaves
# Click Create a new weave > table
# Add Weave Name and click Create
# Drag Date & Time Smartblock, Text Smartblock, Progress Smartblock, Number smartblock, Status Smartblock and Text smartblock
# For the date & time smartblock, fill out until row 4
# Fill out the cells until row 13
# After few hours, go to other pages in Knit. 
# After few hours, go back on the same created Weave with populated data.
# On rows 7 or 8, click the Date & Time smartblock cell, select a date and click Done

Expected: Date should be shown on the cell

Actual: Date is still blank.

You have to click Add row, add a date on that row then go back to existing rows and save the date to show up. See attached video

Actual: Values changed to 0 or disappeared.

summary: PROD | Call | View from screen sharer - no screen shown
description:
Environment: Prod

Issue: If you share your screen, you won’t be able to see it in the Knit call.

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit
# Go to Chat
# On an existing group chat, click Video Call
# Once started, share screen

summary: [PROD][Desktop][Chat] - Hyperlink ignores characters after a '('
description:
URL: [https://sourcefit.knitware.com/|https://sourcefit.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (knitware prod site)

Description:

Pasting a URL directly into the message input box turns it into a hyperlink when sent. However, if the URL includes a ‘(' character, the rest of the characters starting from the '(’ are ignored in the hyperlink.

Actual:

!image-20240306-031309.png|width=510,height=386!

This is usually not an issue as special characters are encoded like ‘%2c’ etc. But Jira or chrome somehow decodes parenthesis into the actual characters.

for example,

{noformat}https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/KNT/issues/?filter=allissues&jql=project%20in%20%28KnitWare%2C%20%22Knit%20MVP%22%29%20ORDER%20BY%20created%20DESC{noformat}

and

{noformat}https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/KNT/issues/?filter=allissues&jql=project%20in%20(KnitWare%2C%20%22Knit%20MVP%22)%20ORDER%20BY%20created%20DESC{noformat}

are the exact same URL. When you open the first URL, the characters then convert into the second one on the omnibar. If a user copies the secon URL then, the pasted link into Knit chat would not work



Expected:

Handle brackets in URLs.  The whole URL must be turned into a hyperlink.



Credentials
please use your own credentials.

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login.
# Open the Chat module
# Open or create a chat
# Paste the ff. into the message input box: {{https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/KNT/issues/?filter=allissues&jql=project%20in%20(KnitWare%2C%20%22Knit%20MVP%22)%20ORDER%20BY%20created%20DESC}}
# Send

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Chart Widget] Minimum "Interval" that can be set is "15%" of the "Maximum" value, but it should be "5%"
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Chart Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + in Value > _Employees_
# Click + in Parameter > _Salary_
# Inspect the Default values
## Min: 0
## Max: 100
## Interval: 10
# Try to lower the “interval” to “5”

*Expected Result:*
Should be able to set interval to “5%” of the value of “Max”

*Actual Result:*
System currently only allows setting of the interval to be as low as “15%” of the Max


*References:*

# [https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-7327|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-7327|smart-link] 
# [https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-7359|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-7359|smart-link] 

!interval15percent.mp4|width=2560,height=1384!





*-Expected Result:-*
-From my testing, the minimum allowed number for “Interval” is 15% of the Max-
-(so Interval value default should be 15)-

*-Actual Result:-*
-Min = 0-
-Max = 100-
-Interval = 10 (when you try to adjust this field, you are not actually allowed to enter numbers lower than 15, but 10 is the default number)-

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Chart Widget] Number fields "widens" when more than 6 numbers will be visible
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Chart Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + in Value > _Employees_
# Click + in Parameter > _Salary_
# Click on the _Salary_ Parameter
# Enter 7 numbers in the “Min” field
# Enter 8 numbers in the “Max” field

*Expected Result:*
UI should not change size when entering numbers

*Actual Result:*
Enter 7 numbers in the “Min” field → causes “Max” field to widen (there is a rule where the Max must be greater than or equal to Min)
Enter 8 numbers in the “Max” field → causes “Interval” field to widen  (there is a rule where the Interval must be at least 15% of the Max value)

!Recording 2024-02-16 165902.mp4|width=2560,height=1394!

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Chart Widget] Pie and Polar chart  does not show a "division" line after the last slice
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Chart Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + in Value > _Employees_

# Click on the Chart Tab > Chart Type > Pie / Polar Area
# Inspect the generated pie chart

Each “slice” has divisions

*Actual Result:*

description:
*Environment:*

*Steps:*

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Chart Widget] Unable to Search for a member until the member appears in the list after scrolling
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

({{https://hrhub.idealforliving.com/api/v1/employees/?page=2}})

*Expected Result:*
Should be able to search for employees that are not yet shown in the Team Member List

*Actual Result:*
Search can only find Team Members from what is already loaded (so in this case {{/api/v1/employees/?page=1}}

However, this is an issue because if a member is in a very last page (let’s say page 45), I have to scroll down so many times


Notes:

(Please apply the fix to wherever applicable)

* Absences
* Undertime
* Late
* Overbreak
* Night Differential
* Offset
* Leaves
* Leave Credits

* Requests
* Work Hours
* Work Days
* Actual Hours
* Actual Days

From [~accountid:712020:8a8454bc-618a-4cb8-8e6b-8d626a9a3e76] 's comment on the original ticket:

# if new schedule is assigned for holiday day, attendance status will be updated according to the newly assigned schedule. So “Holiday” will not be shown, it is needed to reassign holidays to make them appear again - needed to fix on BE side;



Please make sure that holidays still appear even if a new schedule is assigned, as long as the holidays the employee is following are not changed (which seems to be decided by Employee Data instead of schedules).

{color:#ff5630}*_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________*{color}

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Numeric Widget] Show time period has no year value for the first Date
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + > _Employees_
# Click Employees > Filter > Custom Date > [Custom: 02/01/*2024* - 02/28/2024]
# Click Employees > Filter > Hire Date > [Hire Date: 02/01/*2023* - 02/28/2024]
# Go to Appearance tab > Data Display > Show Time Period: On

*Observations:*
Both will display “Feb-Feb 2024”, even though one is Feb 2023 - Feb 2024 and the other is Feb 2024 - Feb 2024

*Questions:*
1. Should we add the year to the first value as well (Feb 2024 - Feb 2024 and Feb 2023 - Feb 2024)?
2. Should we also simplify to show only one Date value when the first date and second date are the same? (ie: [Feb 2024 - Feb 2024] → Show [Feb 2024] only?)
3. Since we also do not have granularity on the “day” level, [Feb 01-Feb 02] and [Feb 01-Feb29], will both show as [Feb - Feb 2024], is this okay?


!2024-02-07 11_30_45-Knit.png|width=1729,height=913!

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Numeric Widget] Cannot save a number element as "0"
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + > _Tasks_
# Go to Formula Tab
# Add “Tasks” (by clicking on “Tasks”)
# Drag a “Number” elements to the Formulas bar
#* This will show an editable field with “0” value
# I want to save this “0” number

*Expected Result:*
I can set a number element to be 0

*Actual Result:*
I cannot save the 0 number, field is in an “editable” state

*Notes:*
Saving of a number is triggered when number field is not 0 and the user clicks outside the editable number element
This means that we cannot save or use the number “0” in Formulas

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Numeric Widget] Cannot move an element to the right or left during the initial state of Formulas

*Environment:*

# Go to Dashboard

# Click + > _Tasks_
# Click + > _Late_
# Go to Formula Tab
# Add Tasks and Late
# Drag and Drop “Tasks” to the right of “Late”

”Tasks” can be moved to the right of “Late”

*Actual Result:*
”Tasks” moves back to its original position



!leftright.mp4|width=1386,height=1374!



*Scenario 2: Move to the left*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _HR Hub_
# Click + > _Tasks_
# Click + > _Late_
# Go to Formula Tab
# Add Tasks and Late
# Drag and Drop “Late” to the left of “Tasks”

”Late” can be moved to the left of “Tasks”

*Actual Result:*
”Late” moves back to its original position

!lr2.mp4|width=1386,height=1370!



{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Notes:*
Looks like the main issue with this is that the “initial” movement to one direction cannot be done, but after that the movement to the opposite direction will be possible 

Example:
1. I initially move a block to the right → this cannot be done; but afterwards I can move an element to the left and moving to the right will work
2. I initially move a block to the left → this cannot be done; but afterwards I can move an element to the right and moving to the left will work
{panel}



This issue is amplified where there are already many elements and the user wants to change the first element to be the last element, user will have to move the element one “block” at a time

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Requests] - Incorrect UI for OT request on day off
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

*The schedule is a Fixed Morning Shift

Users may work on their day off. If it is not pre-approved, the work will be logged as excess. The user can then request to file the exces hours as overtime using the Overtime Request.

Normally, an OT request made for a work day has ‘Add Pre/Post Overtime’ buttons, which attaches the overtime before or after their regular schedule. However, for a day off there is no regular schedule, so the user may just specify their worked hours in the request.

This is the UI for normal OT requests

!image-20240201-070109.png|width=1766,height=917!



Then for a request on a day off, this is the expected UI

!image-20240201-070227.png|width=1759,height=917!



The issue arises when the request date is a day off with an attendance already logged. Even if it is a day off, since there is actual Time In/Out, the Add Pre/Post Overtime buttons still appear.

!image-20240201-070434.png|width=1765,height=918!

Notice that the Date Field has a day but there is neither the schedule or the words ‘Day off’.

This is the attendance log of the date, confirming that the user worked during day off.

!image-20240201-070543.png|width=1542,height=59!



Expected:

The UI should be the same as an OT request for a Day Off with no attendance.



Credentials
user: [throw06@mailinator.com|mailto:throw06@mailinator.com] // throw06!
admin user: [qaAdmin@mailinator.com|mailto:qaAdmin@mailinator.com] // qaAdmin1!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the HR Hub module > Requests
# Create an OT request
## First use a date with a normal work day
## Next use a date with a day off with no attendance
## Then use a date with a day off but has an attendance (worked on day off)

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Numeric Widget] Redo functionality in Formulas is working incorrectly
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Numeric Widget to an empty spot
# Select Module _Tickets_
# Click _Formula_ Tab
# Click on a Data Set (_Tickets_)
# Inspect Redo option

*Expected Result:*
Redo button is still disabled (because no Undo action was done yet)

*Actual Result:*
Redo button is enabled upon the first action “Click on a Data Set (_Tickets_)” and clicking redo causes the Evaluate Formula field to become blank

*Notes:*
My basic understanding of this feature is that every Undo action is stored and Redo simply does the most recent step that was undone

*For example:*
1. Perform Action 1
2. Perform Action 2
3. Perform Action 3
4. Undo → will undo Action 3
5. Undo → will undo Action 2
6. Redo → will do Action 2 again
7. Redo → will do Action 3 again (At this point, Redo is disabled since the undo steps are already empty)

!redo.mp4|width=2560,height=1394!

[DEV][Desktop][Request] - Admin View | No update when adding an attachment to a request then saving
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

Admins can edit an employee schedule request and add attachments, however, when the admin adds an attachment and then saves, there is no update to the slider buttons (discard/save buttons do not revert to approve/reject). When exiting the slider, the attachment is not immediately visible in the attachment column.

Since the buttons do not update, the admin might think to click on save again, but when this is done, an error occurs.

Only after reloading the page will the attachment appear on the column, and the slider buttons are back to approve/reject

Actual:

!chrome_dIAVpbeovM.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!

Expected:

After saving an added attachment, the slider and column must be updated and it should be plainly obvious that the changes were saved successfully.

Credentials
user: [throw01@mailinator.com|mailto:throw01@mailinator.com] // throw01!
admin user: [sean.test@offshorly.com|mailto:sean.test@offshorly.com] // seanKnit1!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the admin account.
# Open the HR Hub module > Requests > team requests
# Open the details of a pending request with no attachments
# Add an attachment then click ‘Save’
# Close the slider, view the attachment column
# Reload the page

summary: Apply correct color scheme and rules for each chart type
description:

h2. *Bar Chart for 1 parameter*

* You can use the Happy day theme and pick the first color for the bars

* each sub group should have their own color by default not just black

||*Expected*||*Actual*||
|!image-20240118-052210.png|width=648,height=372!|!image-20240118-052437.png|width=1394,height=613!|

* each pie slice must have a unique color

Remove X and Y axis

summary: [Dev][Dashboard][Text Widget] Add validation for invalid link in Link Tool
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]


*Steps:*

# Go to Dashboard
# Drag a Text Widget to an empty spot
# Enter some text “abc”
# Highlight the text and click the Link formatting option
# Enter an invalid link (link that does not begin with {{https://}}) and Save
#* *Expected Result:* 
#*# A pop up message should appear "Link is not valid."
#*# Link is not saved
# Enter a valid link (link that begins with {{https://}}) and Save
#* *Expected Result:* 
#*# Link is saved



*Second Jira Description:*

*-Steps:-*

# -Go to Dashboard-
# -Drag a Text Widget to an empty spot-
# -Enter some text “abc”-
# -Highlight the text and click the Link formatting option-
# -Clear the default text that is displayed in the Link field-

*-Expected Result:-*
-There should be no placeholder text [remove the Knit (knitware.com) placeholder text]-

*-Actual Result:-*
-There is a placeholder text Knit (knitware.com)- 

!2024-03-05 13_49_56-Knit (65b3c6b8-ee8a-4832-a67d-5b4e0bcfbc8f).png|width=1920,height=1042!


*First Jira Description:*

*-Steps:-*

# -Go to Dashboard-
# -Drag a Text Widget to an empty spot-
# -Enter some text “abc”- 
# -Highlight the text and click the Link formatting option-
# -Enter “-[-www.google.com-|http://www.google.com]-” as the URL-
# -Highlight on the text “abc” and click the “-[-www.google.com-|http://www.google.com]-” URL-



*-Expected Result:-*
-User is directed to- [-https://www.google.com/-|https://www.google.com/]

*-Actual Result:-*
-User is directed to- [-https://play.idealforliving.com/www.google.com-|https://play.idealforliving.com/www.google.com]


*-Notes:-*
-It seems that when the entered link does not begin with “https” the link becomes environment_url/entered_link-


*-Questions:-*
-How should we handle it when the user enters an invalid link (for example: dog), should it just go to the url “http://dog” ?-
-Or do we add some validation where only valid URLs can be saved? (begins with https:// or www. ?)-

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Requests | Attendance] - Recalculate Undertime, Deficit, and Excess when offset is approved
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

A user may make an offset request to offset past dated attendances when they may have timed out earlier than scheduled. When this is done and approved, previously calculated undertime, deficit, and/or excess should be recalculated to reflect the new updated schedule



Example:

+Schedule+

!image-20240110-060659.png|width=371,height=274!

Schedule is 8h billable, no break, expected time out of 6pm



+Test Data+ (already approved offset)

!image-20240110-060813.png|width=75%!

User has actual time out varying between 3:30pm, 4pm, and 4:30pm for the dates Jan 06-09. (Jan 05 shows the original schedule with ideal time in/out).

!image-20240110-060956.png|width=681,height=214!

!image-20240110-061306.png|width=91.66666666666666%!

User has requested a 2h offset for the select dates (new expected time out is 4pm).

After approval of offset, the previously recorded UT and deficit (1h30m, 2h) should be adjusted given the new schedule (10am-4pm)

In this case

* Jan 07 - UT and Deficit of 30m.. No excess
* Jan 08 - No UT and Deficit. Excess of 30m
* Jan 06 and Jan 09 - No UT, Deficit, and Excess.

For reference: [Sample Offset|https://sourcefitph-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/g/personal/milette_decastro_sourcefit_net/EZATrf8TJvdLvfGbDJCTR1MB0RQzzICJJWd49SJInAK69g?e=qBCyFi]

Credentials
user: [throw01@mailinator.com|mailto:throw01@mailinator.com] // throw01!
admin user: [sean.test@offshorly.com|mailto:sean.test@offshorly.com] // seanKnit1!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the HR Hub module > Requests
# Create an attendance with undertime via time adjustment request (if there are none available)
# Create an offset request to offset the undertime of the relevant attendance date. Approve
# Open the attendance table and confirm if the undertime and deficit values have been adjusted.

summary: [Dev][Tickets] Multiple UI issues in Create Queue screen (5 issues)
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps to go to Create Queue screen:*

# Go to Tickets > All Tickets
# Click green + icon located on the upper right corner of the screen
(please expand each individual section below to see the steps and evidences)



*Issue 1: Missing period in Required Queue Name error message*

*In Create Queue screen:*
1. Type some letters in the Queue Name textbox
2. Clear the Queue Name textbox
*Expected Result:*
Error message appears:
Queue Name can’t be blank. Please enter Queue Name.
*Actual Result:*
Queue Name can’t be blank. Please enter Queue Name
_(missing period at the end)_
!1.png|width=1920,height=1018!

*Issue 2: "Add or remove members" tooltip remains in the screen*

*In Create Queue screen:*
# Hover over the + button of the Queue Managers or Queue Members
# Click the + button
*Expected Result:*
”Add or remove members” tooltip disappears after clicking the + button
*Actual Result:*
”Add or remove members” tooltip remains in the screen even after clicking the + button
!2.png|width=1920,height=1049!


*Issue 3: Placeholder text for adding Queue Members should be "Select members"*

*In Create Queue screen:*
# Click + button of the Queue Members field
*Expected Result:*
Placeholder text is “Select members”
*Actual Result:*
Placeholder text is “Select managers”
!3.png|width=1920,height=1015!

*Issue 4: Incorrect grammar on error message for missing Queue Managers*

*In Create Queue screen:*
# Click X button on each assigned Queue Manager (remove all queue managers)
*Expected Result:*
Error message appears:
Are you sure you won’t add Queue Manager*s* who can work on tickets assigned to this queue?
*Actual Result:*
Are you sure you won’t add Queue Manager who can work on tickets assigned to this queue?
!4.png|width=1920,height=1017!

*Issue 5: Removing a Queue Manager or Queue Member leaves behind an empty name tooltip upon hover*

*In Create Queue screen:*
# Click + button to add a Queue Manager or Queue Member
# Hover over their name bubble → a tooltip of their name is displayed
# Click X button to remove their name bubble
# Hover over the now empty bubble
*Expected Result:*
No tooltip will appear
*Actual Result:*
A tooltip that is an empty string appears
!5a (5deebeb4-6c58-4acc-becf-65277192c400).png|width=1920,height=1018!
!5b (b86ff1be-321a-4921-adb8-29173dbcc551).png|width=1920,height=1046!
!5c (7929488d-2ac0-46a1-a2d8-1038b40d2e3e).mp4|width=2560,height=1392!

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Messages are not loading properly, caused by unread count changes
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]   (staging.knitware)

Description:

Possibly a performance issue.

When first loading a conversation, or switching between conversations, the messages are not loading properly.

# No messages found
!htVBLYDQXV.mp4|width=1918,height=1036!
# When switching messages, the messages from the previous chat is retained
!chrome_00dENmgfRr.mp4|width=1920,height=990!
# New messages do not appear when scrolling
!chrome_FJp2e4Et1N.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!

*when the chat is opened, only the top few new messages are loaded. When scrolling down, the rest should appear. Then if the user switches to another chat then returns, suddenly they are at the bottom of the latest messages.



*The chat module has not been performing adequately recently. Sometimes, the conversations themselves take a while to appear on the list on the left panel. It also takes longer than expected to receive sent messages. And from the recent examples, it takes a while to load the messages in the conversations.

Credentials

summary: [Dev][Projects] Inconsistent behavior in displaying proper Folder name when retyping a folder name for the second time
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Test Data:*
There is a folder named “Folder A”

*Steps to Replicate:*

# Go to Get Knit Done > Projects
# Click on an existing Project (go to list view)
# In the side bar, click … on a project name > Move to folder
# Enter a folder name “folder a”
# Click the “Folder A” that appears from the dropdown
## Notice that the “folder a” that you typed will be replaced with the proper Folder name “Folder A”
# Highlight the “Folder A” text and retype “folder a” again
# Click the “Folder A” that appears from the dropdown



*Expected Result:*
 The “folder a” that you typed will be replaced with the proper Folder name “Folder A”

*Actual Result:*
During the second time, selecting a folder from the Folder list no longer correctly replaces the folder name

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Leaves] - Two pending half day leave requests of different types should be allowed
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

From milette’s comments in [https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-7600|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-7600|smart-link]

!image-20240104-035214.png|width=91.66666666666666%!

Currently however, trying to request two types of half day leaves is blocked by validation.

Actual:

!chrome_nYJgGiq1b3.mp4|width=1920,height=990!

!image-20240104-035338.png|width=518,height=160!

Currently, you can only request two half day leaves if you have the first one approve first, but bulk approve of both at the same time should be allowed also.

Expected:

Two half-day leaves should be allowed for the same day should be allowed as pending as long as

# They are different types of leaves

summary: [Dev][Chat] Some characters in links that are pasted into chat get converted to HTML character codes
description:
*Environment:*
[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]

*Steps to Replicate:*
1. Go to Chat
2. Open or start a new conversation
3. Paste {{https://~!@#$%^&;*()_+{}:"<>?`-=[];',./}} into the chat

*Expected Result:*
Pasted text remains as you copied it

*Actual Result:*
Upon pasting the message, the text is changed to:
{{https://~!@#$%^&;*()_+{}:"<>?`-=[];',./}}

& → {{&}}
< → {{<}}
> → {{>}}


This causes links to not redirect to the correct page, a real world example is:
[https://www.google.com/?source=g&q=openai|https://www.google.com/?source=g&q=openai]
vs
[https://www.google.com/?source=g&q=openai|https://www.google.com/?source=g&q=openai]

[DEV][Desktop][Chat: Video Call] - Video Call original host cannot hide self view
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

IF the user is the original host (one who started the call) of the video call, they cannot hide their self view. For others, or if a user was made a host, they can hide self view no problem.

Actual:

!chrome_Km5QFvnz5B.mp4|width=1920,height=990!

Expected:

at around 00:20:00, the POV of the other user starts. Normal behavior

Credentials
user: [throw01@mailinator.com|mailto:throw01@mailinator.com] // throw01!
admin user: [sean.test@offshorly.com|mailto:sean.test@offshorly.com] // seanKnit1!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the Chat module
# Start a new video call (add another user you have access to)
# once others joined in, make the host hide their self view
# Switch to another user (non host), then hide their self view

summary: HR Hub | Schedule Requests | Fix attachments implementation
description:
Request chosen: Overtime request

Steps to replicate:

# Go to [play.idealforliving.com|http://play.idealforliving.com] and login
# Go to HR Hub
# Go to Team Schedule Requests
# Click a request with attachment
# In the end of the video, there is a bug with attachment, which you have added and saved when editing. If you will try to edit any request with attachment via slider, it will show buttons ‘Discard’ and ‘Save’ instead of ‘Approve’ and ‘Reject’. When editing by modal (for My Requests page) - problem exist too. There is a confuse with usage of file dropzone ui component - loaded (from static server by id) attachment is considered as an edit change while it must not. It is a bug and there should be separate task for that. I

Actual result:

[^screen-capture (85).webm]

Expected result: 
If you are editing the request, Discard and Save buttons should appear.

If you are approving/rejecting the request, Approve and Reject buttons should appear.

Kindly apply for all requests.

summary: [Staging] Dropdown for assigned task is retained
description:
Steps to Replicate:

# In an existing project, add a task in the List View and assign it to someone
# Click Create
# Observe the list table where it will be shown

Actual: Dropdown for assigning task is retained on screen after task is assigned

summary: [DEV | STAGING][Desktop][Attendance] - Corrections on the Deficit and Excess Calculations of Fixed Shift Schedule
description:
For fixed shift schedules, those with set Time In and Time Out, excess and deficit must be computed relative to Time In and Time out and not Total work hours vs Billable Hours.



1.Excess

Excess should be calculated as time worked outside of the schedule. So, if the user timed in earlier than the schedule time in, that is their exit. If the user times out later than their schedule time out, that is their excess. If they have per or post overtime, of course this will not be included in the excess.

Excess is not affected underbreaks. If the user logs an unbillable break that is shorter than their scheduled break duration, this unused break is not added to the excess.

Excess is not offset by deficit.

One way to compute it would be:

excess = max(0, (scheduleTimeIn - actualTimeIn)) + max(0, (actualTimeOut - scheduleTimeOut)) - overtime

*the max(0, x) handles when they are late or undertime so it does not have negative excess



2. Deficit

Deficit should be calculated as time NOT worked inside of the schedule. Simply speaking, it is late, undertime, and overbreaks. For overbreaks, it is any time the user logs breaks longer than the scheduled duration of the break. This excess break is a deficit.

Deficit is not offset by excess and underbreaks.

One way to compute Deficit would be:

deficit = late + undertime + max(0, (scheduleBreakDuration - actualBreakDuration))

*the max(0, x) handles when their actual break is shorter than the scheduled break. This applies for both billable and unbillable break. 

*If the user has multiple breaks, some billable some unbillable, more calculations might be needed.



*Again, this applies only to Fixed Shift*

Since Deficit and Excess does not offset each other. There may be days where the attandance has both Excess and Deficit. 

For example, the user is 20m late, but worked 20m past their scheduled time out. They have both a Deficit of 20m (late) and an Excess of 20m.

This user has 100hrs of leave credits which is equl to 12 Days. They have an approved request for a half-day VL. The Available days is then updated to 96.00 hrs however the days available still shows 12 Days, and the Taken shows 0 Days.

Since half-day leaves are allowed, then the available day should be 11.5 Days, and Taken should be 0.5 Days. (And Carry-over as well if available)



Additionally. *The Earned and Taken should be formatted as: [Number of Days] Days ([Number of hours]) i.e. 12 Days (100.00 hrs)*

But currently it is: Day [Number of Days] ([Number of hours]) i.e. Day 12 (100.00 hrs)

!image-20231124-033555.png|width=209,height=38!

Credentials 
user: [throw06@mailinator.com|mailto:throw07@mailinator.com] // throw06!
admin: [sean.garibay@sourcefit.net|mailto:sean.garibay@sourcefit.net] // seanGaribay1!

summary: HOTFIX| [DEV][Desktop][Requests] - Overtime not calculated when approving time adjustment and overtime request at the same time
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

The user has requested for a time adjustment and overtime request for the same day (past dated, with attendance). The time adjustment coincides with the overtime requested. 

If the requests are approved at the same time, the overtime is not calculated. The timeadjustment becomes excess instead.

Actual:

!chrome_ZhjtGimizR.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!

Expected:

However rare, it is not unusual if users have multiple requests for the same day. The admin may also approve in bulk. Thus, this scenario is very possible.

It is confirmed that if the OT request and the Time adjusment request are approved seperately (in both orders) that the calculations are correctly adjusted and OT is correct. Approvals done at the same time then should also be handled correctly.

Credentials
user: [throw01@mailinator.com|mailto:throw01@mailinator.com] // throw01!
admin user: [sean.test@offshorly.com|mailto:sean.test@offshorly.com] // seanKnit1!

summary: HOTFIX | [DEV][Desktop][Requests] - Cannot submit time adjustment when Time in is earlier than 8am
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

A validation error pops up when users try to submit a time adjustment request that has a Time In earlier than 8am (PST)

Actual:

!image-20231115-073311.png|width=1433,height=1001!

The error states that the Time In is later than the Time Out. Probably due to the actual time in the request which is in the server’s timezone

!image-20231115-073420.png|width=284,height=192!

The issue lies with the timezone differrence. 7am PST is 11pm in server time, but this is the previous day. In the request, although the time is correct (23:00), the start and end time are in the same date.

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Leaves] - Admins should be able to filter leaves by any team that are visible
description:
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]   (play.idealforliving)

Description:

As previously discussed with [~accountid:61d2597cce3652006aa3eb5d] 

If an admin user sees the leave requests within the Team Leaves page, they should be able to filter by all available teams.

Actual:

In this example, the admin user (Sean) is only part of the Software Development team. As seen here, the user can see requests from team members from Marketing, Training, Etc. However, the user can only filter under Software Development team only. 

Currently, in order to filter other teams, the admin user needs to be assigned to other teams as well.



Expected:

It is expected that if the user can filter all requests by all visible teams.

!image-20240103-075900.png|width=66.66666666666667%!

Reference: [HR-Hub-Request-Team-Leaves-Quick-Filter-12-13-2023.xd|https://sourcefitph.sharepoint.com/:u:/s/sharepointdevelopment/EZMEtnVbL61Ml9MxAwpbQw4BaKSJk2JUN9LrkvqGM20vuw?e=MwDCkc]

Credentials
user: [throw01@mailinator.com|mailto:throw01@mailinator.com] // throw01!
user: [sean.test@offshorly.com|mailto:sean.test@offshorly.com] // seanKnit1!



Scenarios:

Feature: Filtering Requests by Teams

  1. Scenario: User filters requests by teams
    Given the user is logged in
    And the user has access to multiple teams
    When the user selects a specific team to filter requests
    Then the system should display only the requests associated with that team

  2. Scenario: User with no team access tries to filter requests
    Given the user is logged in
    And the user has no access to any team
    When the user attempts to filter requests by a team
    Then no team is displayed

 3. Scenario: User switches between different teams
    Given the user is logged in
    And the user has access to multiple teams
    When the user switches between different teams in the filter
    Then the system should update the displayed requests to show only those associated with the newly selected team

 4. Scenario: Team filter persists across sessions
    Given the user is logged in
    And the user has access to a specific team
    When the user logs out and logs back in
    Then the system should remember the last selected team filter and display requests associated with that team upon login

 5. Scenario: User filters requests for any team
    Given the user is logged in with permissions to view/observe other teams' requests
    When the user selects a specific team to filter requests
    Then the system should display requests associated with the selected team, regardless of the user's direct team memberships

summary: [HOTFIX] fix issue with excess hours
description:
Excess are counted incorrectly: 

total_working_time - schedule_billable_seconds - overtime

it should be

total_working_time - actual_billable_seconds - overtime

summary: [DEV][Desktop][Requests] - Hours worked and hours to offset does not adjust if multitple days are selected
description:

Description:

Within the offset request, for each selected date, the hours worked and hours to offset are displayed  which can help the user choose the appropriate dates with excess hours. Currently however, when the user selects multiple consecutive days, the hours to offset does not adjust.

Actual:

!image-20231019-073537.png|width=1762,height=929!

In this example, the there are 3 days selected for the offset, and the end time is adjusted to be 1 hour earlier. 

You would expect that the hours to offset would display ‘3:00’ so that the user knows how much excess hours they need, but it only shows ‘1:00’



Note:

There are still validation if the chosen date with excess does not cover the hours to offset * number of days.

!image-20231019-073737.png|width=447,height=136!

!image-20231019-073743.png|width=524,height=162!

^3 hourse were consumed after approval.

 Therefore, if 3 hours were consumed, then it’s appropriate that the hours to offset should show 3 hours

Credentials
user: [throw01@mailinator.com|mailto:throw01@mailinator.com] // throw01!
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the HR hub module, My Requests
# Open the Offset requests modal
# On the ‘Date to Offset’ field, select multiple consecutive dates
# Take note of the hours to offset field

summary: After Saving the list that I created should be shown on the widget
Createdby for tickets is empty
Colum Format options are missing
description:
Column Format is missing

!image-20230926-074824.png|width=100%!

It should have something like this

!image-20230926-074848.png|width=100%!

So Column format allows you to change the formatting of the table contents. So what are the contents of Format type:

* *None*
** None is the default value for Column Format
** If a Column Format is previously selected (e.g. Percentage) and then the user selects None, it basically removes the column formatting.
* *Percentage*
** Percentage adds % to any of the content inside the column
*** e.g. if cell content is 100, if you select percentage, its going to add 100%
*** e.g. if cell content is “star”, if select percentage, its going to add%, which is star%
* *Hours*
** Hours add the Hours (with space) to any of the content inside the column
*** e.g. if cell content is 5, if you select Hours, it’s going to add (space)Hours, it’s was going to look like “5 Hours”
*** e.g. if cell content is “star”, if you select Hours, it’s going to add (space)Hours, it’s going to look like “star Hours”.
* *Minutes*
** Minutes add the Minutes (with space) to any of the content inside the column.
*** e.g. if cell content is 5, if you select Minutes, it’s going to add (space)Minutes, it’s going to look like “5 Minutes”
*** e.g. if cell content is “star” if you select Hours, it’s going to add (space Star), it’s going to look like  “star Hours”
* *Seconds*
** Seconds is similar to Hours and Minutes.
* *Currency*
** If Currency is selected additional fields will appear
** By default the $ currency is selected. Please find a library for currency symbols.
** The user can select a specific currency they want to show and set it’s alignment
*** If they select right align it will look like this: 100$
*** If they select left align it will look like this: $100
!image-20230926-082227.png|width=93.02%!
* *Date*
** If Date is selected as a column format
** The user can now select a specific date format. Here’s a list of date formats. Here is 08/01/2023 in the different formats
*** MM/DD/YY
**** 08/01/23
*** DD/MM/YY
**** 01/08/23
*** YY/MM/DD
**** 23/08/01
*** Month (Word) Day, Year
**** August 8, 2023
*** M/D/YY
**** 8/1/23
*** D/M/YY
**** 1/8/23
*** YY/M/D
**** 23/8/1
*** D Month (Word), Year
**** 1 August, 2023
*** YYYY/MM/DD
**** 2023/08/01
*** MM/DD/YYYY
**** 08/01/2023
*** DD/MM/YYYY
**** 01/08/2023

!image-20230926-083058.png|width=100%!

* *Custom*
** If custom is selected additional fields will appear
** The Symbol text box allows users to type any type of Symbol
** The Symbol alignment allows users whether to put the symbol on the left or the right of the column content.
** For example I write the & symbol on the Symbol text box and put it on the left align, if I have “start” as the content, the result will look like this: “&start”
*** If I have it right align the result will look like this: “start&”

!image-20230926-081900.png|width=100%!

The text is not that important. Something like: “You need to select time in/time out ranges for all working days” should be okay.

description:

Description:

[HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - 'read-receipt (GET)' API is called a lot of times
description:
In Knit Application, 'read-receipt (GET)' API is called a lot of times.

!image-20230925-023749.png|width=935,height=527!

*Main cause:*

There is a socket event listener "message seen" in FE that is calling an API to get all the participants last read message. The cause of the issue happened earlier is while a lot of users are viewing the same conversation, there are also some new messages. So while a user had read a new message, the socket event "message seen" will be triggered to all of the user that is viewing the same conversation then it will call the API "read-receipts". This happened 30+ times (number of users that are in the same conversation at the same time) thats why there are a lot of "read-receipt" API calls to all of the users.



CC: [~accountid:61d2597cce3652006aa3eb5d] [~accountid:712020:cfa55e49-2878-41a4-80f6-62117b3c1375]

summary: [HOTFIX][Backend] [HR HUB] Breaktime Adjustment doesn't reflect on excess hours
description:
Here is the current attendance details ({{attendance_id=5349}}, {{employee_id=26}}):

!image-20230921-144538.png|width=1490,height=664!

So for working time {{10:30 AM - 9:02 PM}} there is {{10:31 working hours}} (seconds makes 1 min difference, but it is not important in this task). And if you look at the last {{breaktime_adjustment}}, its' duration is {{2 hours}} (again, seconds are not important). So for 8 billable hours, *expected excess* is {{10:31-8:00-2:00 = 0:31}}. But *actual excess* in the attendance table is {{2:31}}:

!image-20230921-150339.png|width=1373,height=770!

In this breaktime adjustment there is a flex break. So I don’t know if problem is in {{breaktime_adjustment}} either in {{flex breaks}}, but flex break here is seemed to not be reflecting on excess/actual billable hours. Please check.

This may confuse users.

!chrome_15saYEi2Bu.mp4|width=1920,height=1000!

Expected:

No scroll down button for chats with little to no messages.

user: [throw07@mailinator.com|mailto:throw07@mailinator.com] // throw07!

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Sometimes, attached images do not appear in the preview
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]   (staging.knitware)

Description:

When sending an image attachment to any chat, sometimes the image is not immediately available in the preview. When the user clicks on the image, another image shows up, and the original image is not present in the gallery below. The image also does not immediately appear in the Shared files menu in the chat info and settings panel. 

It seems like the image is not yet seen by the server, but exists client side only. Only after page reload, the image will now behave normally.

A possible trigger for this issue is by switching chat right after uploading an image. See video #2. Although, the bug is not consistently reproduceable. Possible network issues could also be a variable.

Actual:

#1

!chrome_hz6xdd1lsR.mp4|width=83.33333333333333%!

#2

!chrome_4PWfQUkTRQ.mp4|width=83.33333333333333%!



Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw07@mailinator.com|mailto:throw07@mailinator.com] // throw07!



Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the Chat module
## Have several chats ready
# Setup: Have several images uploaded in several chats. Reload the page.
# In one chat with images uploaded, send an image attachment
## Preview the image once sent. 
## View it in the shared files in the chat info and settings panel
# Switch to another chat
# Go back to the original chat
## Preview the most recently sent image
## Preview the other earlier sent images
## See the attached files in the chat info and settings panel
# Reload the page. Repeat step 6 substeps

# go to the GR hub - my request

The time disappears. There is a message about changes while closing the window. But there are no changes.

!Knit - Google Chrome 2023-09-14 16-59-10.mp4|width=1920,height=1020!

Time is visible and relates to the time that users choose while creating the Breaktime Adjustment.


UPD (developer [~accountid:712020:8a8454bc-618a-4cb8-8e6b-8d626a9a3e76]):
While investigating a bug, I noticed that {{id}} of break belongs to a next day ({{09/13}} instead of {{09/12}}). I checked the code and found a problem. Bug appeared because when hovering date on calendar, breaktime options in the selector are changing. So I think here were such steps of breaktime creation:

# Select e.g. 09/12/2023
# Open calendar again, hover 09/13/2023 and close calendar by clicking out of it
# select break and time
# create request

summary: [HOTFIX] [PROD] [Desktop] [Projects] Uh oh something went wrong Error appears
description:
In the Projects page, the popup error that Uh oh something went wrong appears.

Date tested: August 30, 2023

!image-20230904-102437.png|width=75%!

!image-20230904-102445.png|width=75%!



Environment: Production

Steps to Replicate.

# Register to [knitware.com|http://knitware.com] then log in.
# Go to Projects.
# Close the walkthru.
# Observe popup error message.

Actual Result: Popup error that Uh oh something went wrong shows up.

Expected Result: No popup error should appear.



Initial checking from Vadim:

Found sentry issue from FE that you triggered. 

Looks like FE allows for 2 button presses in the modal window. That created 2 requests to the BE: 1 was successful, but the second was executing at the same time as the first and tried creating an instance that was created already. 

Not sure if something like that needs an urgent hotfix, but we need to do:

# Disable buttons on requests to forbid making multiple requests at the exact same time.
# I'll make that transaction atomic so it will make 2 DB requests at the same time, not one after another.

summary: Chat conversation is not working between ticket submitter and assigned queue
description:
Issue: Different conversation is shown for the same ticket.

Environment: Dev

Steps to replicate:

# Log in to 2 accounts in Knit – 1 for the queue member and 1 for the ticket submitter
# For the queue member, go to Tickets. Click Create Queue, add a queue name and add yourself as a queue member.
# For the ticket submitter, go to Tickets, Click Submit and select the queue created by the queue member. Select Inquiry or any type of ticket. Fill out the required fields and click Submit.
# In the 2 accounts, go to Tickets and select the same ticket submitted. 
# Click Chat button.
# As a ticket submitter, send a message.

*Expected:*

*The ticket submitter’s message will be seen by the queue member.*

*Actual:*

*No message from the ticket submitter is seen*



7. As the queue member, send a message to the ticket member in the same chat window in the same ticket.

*Expected:*

*The queue member’s message will be seen by the ticket submitter.*

*Actual:*

*A different message is seen, not coming from the queue member.*

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Attendance] - Flex Shift, deficit and excess should also be calculated
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

For a flexible shift schedule, ther time in and time out is close to 24 hours, meanng they have a whole day for their time in/out range. Because of ths, there really is no late and undertime. However, they do stll have billable hours. Excess is the amount of time that the user has worked after their billable hours. Deficit is the time the user failed to work to meet their billable hours. Hence, there should be deficit and excess calculations.

Actual:

!image-20230815-091055.png|width=91.66666666666666%!

No deficit and excess. Aug 14 entry has capped billable but they worked in excess of that. Other days have not reached 8hr billable, thus they should have deficit.

Expected:

Deficit and excess hours should be calculated in relation to the billable hours, whiile also taking into consideration non-billable breaks (if implemented).

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!
