summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Audio Call, video  is not disabled by default for audio calls
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

When starting/joining an audio call, it is expected that the cameras will be turned off by default, regardless of their last state (when in a video call). Currently however, it seems that this is not the case.

!ivYqQAjMa6.mp4|width=100%!

In the video…

It was initially shown that the last call ended with both mics and cams enabled. This was in a video call.

Next, an audio call was initiated by one user. 

For the caller, the camera icon indicates that it is disabled but the video is still on in the call (the black screen is because my webacam is covered. If the camera is disabled, the initials of the user is shown).

For the joiner, the icon is not shown as disabled, and the video is on in the call.



Since for the caller, the icon is shown to be disabled, i’d assume that the intention is for the video output to be disabled by default, for both users.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Call, host who left the call can still admit/deny participants
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

In a call with a waiting room, the host can leave the call and assign then role of host to another user. However, even if the original host left the call (if they are still within the call tab) they still receive the “participants has joined” notification and can still admit/deny participants.

Actual:

!ooSJkyFyiM.mp4|width=3840,height=1080!

Expected:

The original host should not receive the notifications nor should they be able to admit/deny participants



*additionally, if the original host admits/denies the otherr participant and the new host does the same, the ‘not found’ error pops up

!image-20230811-081320.png|width=309,height=243!



Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the chats module
# Initiate a call in a GC
# Enable the waiting room
# Wait for at least one participant to join and admitted
# leave the call and assign another participant as host. Do not close the tab
# Have another participant join
# As the original host, admit/deny the participant

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Calls, Not Found error
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

{color:#ff5630}*UPDATE*{color}

This issue seems to be happening again (as of this update, 09/20/23). Sometimes, when ending the call, the join button still remains on the chat. Clicking on the join button opens a call tab but the error: Not found appears.

!image-20230920-070047.png|width=1316,height=906!

!image-20230920-070051.png|width=1900,height=1015!



________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Description:

!image-20230810-042900.png|width=607,height=250!

This error is often encountered when testing the chat video/audio call. The main cause is unknown, and it is hard to replicate. There are possibly many different scenarios or steps that could lead to this, but it does happen often enough for it to be noticeable.

The following recording is just one of the ways to reliably replicate the issue, although this is not the sole cause.

!Tel1eV56xh.mp4|width=100%!

The most plausible lead to this is when users are joining  and rejoining the call. Even though the link is the same, sometimes there are confusions between call instances. There have been times when two users try to rejoin the same call (that has been ended for all) at the same time and each of them seems like they started two separate call but still under the same link. Other times, if they try to rejoin simultaneously, one user is unable to join because “they are already in the call” even when they are not.

There should probably be safeguards against these scenarios. 

{color:#ff5630}*This issue will be a general ticket for these kinds of bugs within the call function. I will try to provide more details, screenshots, and recordings when I encounter these issues again.*{color}

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!



Steps to reproduce:

{noformat}>user 1 hosts
>user 2 joins
>user 1 leaves, assign user 2 host
>user 1 joins
>user 1 ends meeting for all
>user 2 rejoins
>wait for user 2 to fully connect, then user 1 rejoins
>user 1 leaves
>user 2 leaves{noformat}

summary: View Ticket Details Left Pane - Missing Priority Level, Impact Level and Urgency Level
description:
In the Ticket Details Left pane, Priority Level, Impact Level and Urgency Level are missing.

Environment: Dev ([https://play.idealforliving.com/helpdesk/tickets/details/ISI1-20230809-00006|https://play.idealforliving.com/helpdesk/tickets/details/ISI1-20230809-00006|smart-link] )

XD Link: [https://sourcefitph.sharepoint.com/:u:/s/sharepointdevelopment/EWq25VbvZGZGmmCasrud6oIBkJZ9G1fEUWbr2qR0jsZWRg?e=5opHBj|https://sourcefitph.sharepoint.com/:u:/s/sharepointdevelopment/EWq25VbvZGZGmmCasrud6oIBkJZ9G1fEUWbr2qR0jsZWRg?e=5opHBj|smart-link] 

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit and go to Tickets.
# View My Tickets
# Click a submitted ticket or a ticket assigned to you.
# Scroll down the left pane.

Expected: Priority Level, Impact Level and Urgency Level are shown after the Due Date.

!image-20230809-113300.png|width=1423,height=801!

Actual: Priority Level, Impact Level and Urgency Level are missing.

!image-20230809-113507.png|width=1583,height=799!

See [Ticket Details Revamp 082423.xd|https://sourcefitph.sharepoint.com/:u:/s/sharepointdevelopment/EWq25VbvZGZGmmCasrud6oIBkJZ9G1fEUWbr2qR0jsZWRg?e=N5CIlb]

Note: Priority Level has settings on how it is determined: [Queue Settings - Prioritization - KnitWare - Confluence (atlassian.net)|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KNIT/pages/2020048914/Queue+Settings+-+Prioritization] and [Priority Colors - KnitWare - Confluence (atlassian.net)|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KNIT/pages/2147713168/Priority+Colors].  

By default, the priority levels chosen are P1-Critical, P2-High, P3-Normal, P4-Low, P5-Very Low, Not Set.

By default, the urgency level are 1 - High Urgency, 2 - Medium Urgency, 3 - Low Urgency, Not Set

By default, the impact level are 1 - High Impact, 2 - Medium Impact, 3 - Low Impact, Not Set

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Waiting room issues when changing hosts
description:
Description:

In a call with a waiting room, only the host has permission to admit/deny participants in the waiting room. If there is already a participant in the call and the host leaves, they have to give the other participant the host role as well.

However, the call settings, specifically the waiting room enabled setting, is not inherited by the new host. Users already in the waiting room are not visible to the new host. New joiners who are put in the waiting room are not seen by the new host.

The new host must first enable the waiting room, then have the participants in the waiting room leave then rejoin, in order for the new host to see them.

Actual:

!m9l8TidieS.mp4|width=100%!

Expected:

Along with the host perms, the new host should inherit the enabled waiting room state, and whatever relevant settings from the original host.

Credentials

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Audio/Video Call, changing the microphone device in the audio settings does not actually change the audio input device
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

The user should be able to freely change their speaker devices while already in the call. However, there is some issues currently.

*it is a little difficult to provide a recording for this one… so there isn’t one.

The setup: The call was initiated and the the default microphone device was set.

In the test, there are two available microphone devices. Device A is the default. When the user tries to change the microphone to device B by either changing in the quick audio settings, or changing the audio settings modal and saving, the actual audio input device is not changed. The audio is still coming from device A.

We can also however confirm that when testing the microphone via the ‘test mic’ button, the switching of microphone devices work. So the function works in this scenario only, but not on the actual call.



Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!



Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the Chat module
# Initiate a call, set your microphone device
# Open the call on the other participant as well
# Change the mic device via
## quick audio settings
## audio settings modal, and save
# Verify if the correct mic is being used

description:

Description:

The user should be able to freely change their speaker devices while already in the call. However, there is some issues currently.

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING | PROD][Desktop][Projects] - Adding a subtask, the responsiveness is too slow
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

The user can add a subtask to a task via the side panel (accessible in list view). Upon submitting the subtask (hitting enter), the action takes too long to complete. There is no visual feedback while the request is being processed (the time the user hits enter to the time the success message appears).

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Issues regarding the audio in calls
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

It is expected that when a user starts a new call, the audio and video toggles retain their last state. So if they ended the last call while muted, they will still be muted on the next call. Similar happens with the video as well.

However, in the following demo, we will see that this is not the case. The last state is not actually retained, and though while the icon is ‘muted’, the audio still goes through.



Please watch this video in its entirety. Pardon the slow speech and stuttering, the double audio output is messing with my brain.

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gvILdmZWS84zPHtWZ6UAgcfIiqh4HkY2/view?usp=sharing|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gvILdmZWS84zPHtWZ6UAgcfIiqh4HkY2/view?usp=sharing|smart-embed]

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Errors when reloading the tab while in  a call
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

According to an acceptance criteria within [https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-5300|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/browse/KNT-5300|smart-link], reloading the page should retain the existing call.

The scenario: two users are in a call.

!kfG2QlMmCJ.mp4|width=100%!

When the joiner reloads the page, they are able to return to the call no problem. In the perspective of the host, the joiner leaves then returns quickly.

When the caller/host reloads the page, they are returned to the call but the other user is no longer there. In the perspective of the other user, the host never left.



!1fqm3rnAZ4.mp4|width=100%!

Afterwards, once either user reloads the page (in an effort to have the call return to normal), an error popped up, and there is trouble connecting to the call.



!3NPeWAqOKg.mp4|width=100%!



Then, the call tabs were both closed.

!3NPeWAqOKg (2284738c-fcf6-46ed-85e1-1d5ccd0f3281).mp4|width=100%!

The join button is still on the chat conversation even if there are no users in the call (this is a p2p chat). Reloading the page does not make the join buttons disappear.



Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the chat module
# initiate a call in an existing p2p chat
# when both users are in the call, first reload the joiner call tab
# reload the host call tab
# reload the joiner again, then the host (second time now)
# close both call tabs
# reload the chat pages for both

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Requests] - Approved overtime does not reflect on the schedules
description:

Description:

A request for overtime is requested then approved. The change in the schedule (due to the added time of the overtime) is expected to be reflected in the attendance page, and the employee schedule page, but they are not.

As a comparison, a change in schedule request, once approved, is reflected in the attendance page and the employee schedule page.

!image-20230725-083412.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

^both requests approved

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Unread messages count won't go away
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

The unread messages counter on the chat list and within the chat does not disappear even after scrolling to the bottom (most recent) of the messages.

Actual:

!chrome_nNQbX0vR48.mp4|width=1920,height=1078!

As seen here, when viewing the unread messages, there are indeed API calls that confirm that messages are being read. It also looks like the counter is going down (but not fully disappearing. 

After a short moment, the counter returns back to 10, and there are no API calls regarding read receipts anymore. Now the counter is stuck at 10. Even if you reload the page, the counter does not disappear.



!chrome_j3TkiMHSMp.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

Only after sending a message is the unread messages counter truly disappear

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Weaves] - Progress Smartblock, slider should re-enable disabled -/+ buttons
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

If the value of the progress is either 0 or 100, the - and + buttons in the UI is disabled respectively. However, if the user changes the value by sliding the slider, the -/+ buttons are not re-enabled. 

Actual:

!chrome_qA4d9DN1kl.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

The user may only re-enable these buttons by clicking on the active one of the two (+/-).

summary: Staging | Desktop | Ticketing | Text Box Element in Forms - Placeholder Text can Input more than 1000 Characters
description:
*Scenario*: When a Text Box Element is added to the form and the user is setting the placeholder for the Text Box via the Settings.



*Expected Result*: The placeholder field can only type up to 1000 characters and any character typed after the 1000th will not be reflected/seen in the field.

*Actual Result*: The placeholder field can type more than 1000 characters

!image-20230711-060047.png|width=2022,height=934!



*Steps to Replicate and more details can be seen here:* [*KNT-3790 - Textbox Element Settings Test Cases.xlsx*|https://sourcefitph-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/g/personal/gabrielle_raymundo_sourcefit_net/ESjNmJf22QhEiK7omTA2GegBHZiSsnm1lyW5yM_8y4TP2A?e=PvYsPm&nav=MTVfezFEQTk4QzU5LTQzMjMtNEVCMC05MUVELTZGRTI0NDEwQzU3Q30] *(under Sheet Name “6”*

summary: Staging | Desktop | Ticketing | Text Box Element in Forms - Single line Maximum Characters is set to 1000
description:

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Attendance] - Attendance table calculations are incorrect
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

It seems that the attendance table is not working correctly in the staging site.

# The ‘Late’ status is not showing if the user is late

!image-20230711-021453.png|width=75%!

this user is late however their status is ‘Not Available’ (which is usually the status for employees if it is still earlier than their time in) instead of ‘Late’



# The calculations are incorrect

!image-20230711-021614.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

Deficit Calculation is correct.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - New floating chats are not visible if there are minimized chats
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

At first, the user can open floating chats and they appear as expected. If the user minimizes some chats, then open new ones (while there are minimized chats), the new chats do not appear on screen if the chat list is not open.

Actual:

!chrome_VCw5icKked.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

Expected:

Chats are still visible if there are minimized chats. Chats do not hide with the chat list.

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the any module that has the floating chat icon (bottom right. any module that is not chat)
# Open a couple of floating chats
# Minimize the floating chat
# Open new floating chats

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - New floating chats should appear on the left
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

How new floating chats are opened are explicitly defined in the [requirements.|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KNIT/pages/2113699854/Floating+Chat+-+Opening+Chat+Tabs] Once the user clicks on the floating chat icon (note icon), the chat list appears to the left of the active floating chats. Once the user selects a chat, it is expected that the new chat replaces the chat list, thus appearing to the left of the active chat.

Currently however, the new chat appears to the right. Visually, this looks a bit jarring as the active chat is suddenly moved to the left. If the new chat appears to the left of the active chats, the flow looks smoother.

Actual:

!chrome_0UCsFR6tQk.mp4|width=1920,height=1008!

Expected:

New chats should appear to the left of the active chats, replacing the chat list.

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Minimized floating chats should combine if they exceed 6 chats minimized
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

As described in the [requirements|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KNIT/pages/2109473310/Floating+Chat+-+Chat+Icon+Behavior], if the user minimizes the floating chat, as the minimized chats exceed 6, the earliest chats should be combined and the chat icon is replaced by a number, indicating how many chats more are available. Clicking on the icon will display the list of chats that are hidden/combined.

Actual:

!image-20230707-032007.png|width=287,height=532!

8 minimized chats displayed here

Expected:

!image-20230707-031917.png|width=351,height=305!

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

summary: Dashboard sharing deletion message adjustment
description:
IF DASHBOARD TYPE IS Shared_by_me

The white sheep message should be: This is a shared dashboard. Deleting this will permanently delete the copy of the dashboard shared to others and cannot be undone. Continue?

IF FOLDER CONTAINS A Shared_by_me DASHBOARD

The white sheep message should be: This folder contains a shared dashboard. Deleting this will permanently delete the copy of the dashboard shared to others and cannot be undone. Continue?

IF DASHBOARD TYPE IS Shared_to_me 

The white sheep message should be: This dashboard was shared to you. Deleting this will remove you from shared list. This action cannot be undone. Continue?

IF FOLDER CONTAINS A Share_to_me DASHBOARD

The white sheep message should be: This folder contains a dashboard was shared to you. Deleting this will remove you from shared list. This action cannot be undone. Continue?

IF FOLDER CONTAINS DASHBOARDS WITH THE TYPE Shared_to_me and Shared_by_me

The white sheep message should be: This folder contains a dashboard that was shared to you and you shared to others. Deleting this will remove you from the shared list and remove the shared copy from other users. Continue?

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Admin - Schedule] - If an error appears from validation or required fields, only the affected field should be highlighted
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

There are several checks for validation of fields and if the form is being submitted with missing required fields. IIf they are violated, error messages appear and the affected fields are highlighted in red. 

Currently however, when an error pops up, some fields remain highlighted in red even if they are not affected.
Isolating the highlight to only the affected fields should help the user to more easily locate the source of the problem.

Uers could mistakenly assume that some fields are wrong just becaue they were highlighted even if they are not the cause of the error.

Breaks

!chrome_ygApg4YPmX.mp4|width=876,height=138!

* All the field under breaks are highlighted red even if only one is missing
* Validation error for the duation also casuses all the fields to be highlighted
* The Billable checkbox should never be highlighted since it is not required nor has validations



Working Days 

!chrome_7XxtBK2t0p.mp4|width=1738,height=344!

* The highlights for the checkbox of the working days never go away even if some are already selected or the erorr pertains to the time in and time out fields



Range of Flexible hours (set flexible)

!image-20230703-070401.png|width=686,height=181!

* both fields are highlighted even if only one is missing
* The round off checkbox (including the one in full flexi) should never be highlighted since it is not required nor has validations



Additionally, for:

* Schedule title field and color button
* Total work hours and period dropdown

since these pairs are conjoined, I’m not sure if their highlights cannot be separated?

!image-20230703-070748.png|width=394,height=98!

!image-20230703-070815.png|width=686,height=74!

although it would be better if the highlight is only for the affected par too.



Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Issues regarding new chats with unread messages
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

The following issues arise from a newly created chat with one unread message.

Scenario:

A user created a new chat (no history) with another user. The user then sends the first message (only one).

The recepient user logs in and views their chat. They see that there is one unread message on a chat.

Issues:

* The unread counter does not go away even if the user has already read the message.
** This is possibly due to the small amount of messages (in this case just one) on this chat. There is no where to scroll to, thus it does not detect that the message has been read.
** Even if the user force reloads the page, the unread counter is still there
* Sending a message back looks like 3 messages are sent instead of one.
** One way to remove the unread counter is to send a message back, but it looks like multiple of the same messages are sent
** Once the user reloads the page after the sent message, the sent message is now actually just one, and the unread counter is gone.

See these examples (2 instances)

!chrome_A3TEpvxv9C.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

!chrome_ElzWi3KVHW.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!



Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the Chats module
# Create a new chat (user with no previous chat)
# Send the first message (only 1)
# Switch to the other user, open the new chat
# Try to have the unread counter disappear (scrolling, switching between chats, reload)
# Send a message back

* The task name does not change even if the success message “Project Task successfully updated” appeared once the name was retyped.

summary: [HOTFIX] Missing data cell value and unable to add more data without delay
description:
Issue: Missing data cell value and unable to add more data without delay

Environment: staging

Weave URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/weaves/995dc227-98d1-4d1a-9896-bfac5bd6f6a8|https://staging.knitware.com/weaves/995dc227-98d1-4d1a-9896-bfac5bd6f6a8|smart-link] 

Steps to Replicate:

# Go to Weaves and open Status Report Sample ([https://staging.knitware.com/weaves/995dc227-98d1-4d1a-9896-bfac5bd6f6a8|https://staging.knitware.com/weaves/995dc227-98d1-4d1a-9896-bfac5bd6f6a8|smart-link] )
# Add another data in the last row under Specific Tasks for example. Type a long text and click outside of it.

*Actual:*

# Page stucks up or will show the text input after a couple of minutes
# Text data could not be entered even after 30 minutes.

!image-20230614-101919.png|width=1705,height=917!

3. When page was reloaded, 1 data cell was missing.

!image-20230614-101845.png|width=1230,height=777!



*Expected:*

# Data should be entered smoothly without delays



Note from Vadim:

This is FE issue, a lot of objects on the page and your browser is lagging.

If we want to have a lot of cells in the weaves, we need to use lazy loading or something. 

I think the best way of doing that is to check how [http://monday.com|http://monday.com|smart-link]  and google spreadsheets are handling that amount of data and do it in the similar way. 

That weave even crashed for me when I tried to do a lot at once. 

After the research of [http://monday.com|http://monday.com|smart-link]  and google spreadsheets from one of the FE developers, I think brainstorming with some FE devs will be good to. You can invite both Denises, Jerome, Alex, maybe someone else too. Maybe they will be able to suggest something.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Weaves] - Number smartblock, measurement unit in the dropdown should match the one in rows
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

Measurement units are very specific and how they are written should not vary. In fact, these units are case sensitive in order to separate them from similarly spelled units. In the smartblock customization UI, the user can choose which type of measurement the particular smartblock (and the data entered) will be via a dropdown menu. The menu lists all possible units of measurement however many of the unit symbols have unnecessary capitalizations. Again, I must emphasize that these symbols are intentionally written a specific way as they are standardized units.

At the very least, the symbols represented in the dropdown should match the ones used in the actual rows of data. The symbols in the data are correct, therefore the symbols in the dropdown must be updated.

Actual:

The length units mostly have unnecessary capitalizations

|!image-20230606-031347.png|width=172,height=294!|!image-20230606-031350.png|width=164,height=290!|!image-20230606-031352.png|width=33.33333333333333%!|

Please follow how they are written here: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Convert/list_of_units/length|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Convert/list_of_units/length|smart-link] 

Additionally

* micrometre should use the mu symbol (μ) in the dropdown as well
* A misspelling of Decimetre
!image-20230606-031722.png|width=127,height=32!

* The angstrom unit does not fit into the block
** actual:
!image-20230606-032530.png|width=31,height=37!
** expected:
!image-20230606-032542.png|width=34,height=30!



For weight measurements, again, unnecessary capitalizations

!image-20230606-031802.png|width=163,height=289!

list here: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Convert/list_of_units/mass|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Convert/list_of_units/mass|smart-link] 

Again, the micro unit for microgram



No discrepancies with the temperature units.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Chats appear in the wrong chats list (active, ignored, blocked)
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

Currently, there are three separate chat lists: active, ignored, and blocked. Normally, each list is filtered depending if a user has blocked or ignored specific chats. Ignored chats for example would be removed from the active chats and can only be viewed in the ignored chats list. The same happens for blocked chats.

Currently however, the chats appear on any chat list, regardless if they are active, ignored or blocked. 

See the following example.

!chrome_0G3W6NljEM.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

The ignored and blocked chats list are empty, but when a message is sent (from a chat that is neither ignored nor blocked), the chat appears on those respective lists.

It seems that all the chats just appear on any and all chat lists whenever a new message is sent.

If an ignored or blocked chat has sent a message, they too will appear in the active chats list.

To add to this, these chats are not actually categorized as ignored or blocked since they disappear once the page is reloaded. Actual ignored or blocked chats stay on their respective chat list once the page is reloaded.

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the chats module
# open the blocked chats
# send a message from an non-blocked chat
# open the ignored chats
# send a message from a non-ignored chat

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Wrong messages are being mistakenly displayed on other chats *UPDATED
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

{color:#ff5630}*_UPDATE_*{color}

This bug is being reopened due to a very similar issue occuring again.

Not exactly limited to new chats only. When switching from one chat to another, sometimes the contents of the first chat are being displayed on the next chat that is opened.

This bug is intermittent. This does not happen always. This may be caused by network ocnnecticity issues, but could also be driven by performance issues on the server side. Fetch requests may also have been delayed if there is a lot of traffic on the site (most occurrence were discovered on Sep. 18 2023, when a lot of skype GCs were migrated to knit). Either way,, there could always be room for improvement on the chat module’s performance, especially regarding the fetching of conversations.



Recent example:

*messages from the Knit Dev GC are being displayed on the p2p chat with Alex

!image-20230919-043921.png|width=100%!



________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

*ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION:*

There seems to be an issue with how messages are loaded into chats.

Consider this scenario:

The user has an existing group chat. This group chat has a history of messages already.

The user then creates a new group chat, with completely new members, except for one who is also a member of the earlier group chat.

As soon as this new group chat is created, messages from the original group chat are loaded into the new group chat. Although to be clear, the messages from the old group chat is not actually saved into the new group chat, this is just a client side mistake as once the chat is reloaded (usually by switching to another chat, then switching back), the old messages are gone.

Actual:

!chrome_LDDZkQM5z2.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to URL and login with the user account.
# Open the chat module
# Open or create a group chat
# Send several messages to uniquely identify the chat
# Create a new group chat
## You must include at least one member from the old group chat
## You must include at least one new member (in order to create a new and separate chat from the old one)
# After sending the first message, pay attention to the message history/thread

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][HR Hub] - Possible network error and error on requests
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]  (staging.knitware)

Description:

There are several errors that popup when opening some pages in the staging site. It is unknown if it is the main cause of some of the bugs but there are several issues that became apparent recently.

First, once the user opens the HR Hub page the following group of errors pop up.

!image-20230530-050207.png|width=75%!

It seems that api calls are being blocked by the CORS policy. Some searching led me to suspect that this is a chrome issue, so I tested via firefox. This is the console log from first opening the HR hub

!image-20230530-050616.png|width=75%!

At first glance, the CORS error does not seem to show up here, but some actions do seem to lead to this as well.

!image-20230530-050757.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

This one is caused by trying to logout. Which leads us to the next issue. 

Some API links seem to have a typo in them.

If you look closely on the first screenshot (from chrome), there is this error:

!image-20230530-050942.png|width=366,height=61!

The debug page shows us:

!image-20230530-051104.png|width=384,height=36!

!image-20230530-051031.png|width=309,height=16!

It looks like there’s an extra '/'?

Other than this request we also have

+*Logout*+

!image-20230530-051222.png|width=358,height=62!

which causes the user to not be able to log out

+*Email verification*+

!image-20230530-051907.png|width=399,height=108!

which makes the user unable to signup for a new account, the page is just forever in this state

!image-20230530-051937.png|width=435,height=125!

+*Chats*+

The chat page does not open in staging. The page times out and is not loaded completely

!image-20230530-052129.png|width=1246,height=803!

There are 2 undefined errors here:

!image-20230530-052152.png|width=374,height=62!

!image-20230530-052202.png|width=358,height=62!



These are just some of what I could find. There could be more.

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][HR Hub] - Cannot submit overtime request when the end time is 12 am (midnight) or later
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]   (staging.knitware)

{color:#ff5630}*UPDATE*{color}

If the range of the post overtime crosses midnight (12am), the end date is being seen as earlier than the scheduled end time, thus a validation error pops up and the user cannot submit.

Actual:

!image-20231006-032349.png|width=58.33333333333333%!

in this example, the schedule ends at 5pm. The requested post overtime end time is at 1am. Ideally, the system should see this as 1am next day, but it seems like it’s being treated as 1am of the same day, hence the error “Time range should be after end time.”



Another example

!image-20231006-032541.png|width=620,height=606!



----

Original Description

Description:

When a user requests for an overtime, the total hours of overtime is calculated based on the given start and end times. However, if the end time is at 12am (midnight) or later, the calculated overtime total hours becomes wrong.

For this test, the user has a 2-11pm schedule (adjusted for PST).

!image-20230524-102315.png|width=508,height=82!

Actual:

!image-20230524-102346.png|width=503,height=222!

First, if we set the end time to 11:59pm, the total hours is 59m, which is correct. But if we make the end time 12am, we have:

!image-20230524-102308.png|width=510,height=223!

the total hours is 0 instead of 1h.

!image-20230524-102518.png|width=504,height=213!

for 1am, it is still 0



The other way around, if the start time is earlier, there is no problem

!image-20230524-102617.png|width=502,height=225!



Expected:

At any time zones, there may be shifts whose schedule passes midnight (night or graveyard shifts for example), so this should be accounted for in the calculations.

Credentials
user: [throw02@mailinator.com|mailto:throw02@mailinator.com] // throw02!
user: [throw03@mailinator.com|mailto:throw03@mailinator.com] // throw03!



Steps to replicate:

# Open the HR hub
# Open My Requests>Make Schedule Request
# Select Overtime

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][HR Hub] - Attendance: late, UT, deficit, and excess recorded should readjust if a time adjustment request was approved
description:
URL: [https://staging.knitware.com/|https://staging.knitware.com/|smart-link]   (staging.knitware)

Description:

Whenever a user times in/out that is far from their scheduled shifts, deficit (late, UT) and excess work hours are recorded. The user may also adjust their time in/out to reflect their actual work hours. in this event, then the deficit and excess should be adjusted accordingly. 

This is not currently the case.

Actual:

!image-20230524-101411.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

In this test data, the user was originally late and undertime (thus also having deficit). The user requested a time adjustment (which was approved) to set their actual time in/out to be the same as their shift schedule.

!image-20230524-101630.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

As you can see, their Tim in/out is the same as their Shift Schedule, but the lat, UT, and deficit values remain the same. 

Expected:

Since the actual time in/out is their scheduled shift, there should be no deficits lates or UT.
In any other scenario,, the late, UT, deficit and excess values should be readjusted if a time adjustment is approved.

Credentials

description:

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Projects] - 'Repeat on' and 'Repeat every' should be exclusively required
description:
When creating meetings, the user has the  option to make a custom recurrence for the meeting. There is however some logical contradictions that arise when  choosing the ‘Repeat every’ and ‘Repeat on’ fields due to them both being required.


For example:

The user chooses ‘Repeat every: 3 Days’ (starting from the  selected date). If the start date is on a Monday, then logically the meeting will repeat on Thursday, then Sunday, then Wednesday etc. 
However, the ‘Repeat on’ options are also required, which locks the meeting on certain days of the weeks instead of  every 3 days.


A redesign for this is being discussed to account for repeat every X days/week/month/year, but for now please make ‘Repeat on’ *not required*.

!image-20230427-052857.png|width=672,height=145!

Expected:

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Projects] - Quick Edit Actions not in the correct context
description:
In  the projects center, you can use the Quick Edits Menu to quickly rename, duplicate, delete etc. each project, folder or tasks. On the item that you want to perform an action to, hover the cursor over the item to reveal the options icon (three dots), then click to reveal the Quick edits menu. 

However, the actions does not seem to have the correct context. Meaning, if I were to use the quick edits to duplicate a project, then it is that project that should be duplicated. What happens currently, is the actions is being performed on the project that is currently open in the view section of the page.

Consider the following:

!chrome_nPj0Wza9c9.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

* Renaming a project, action is performed on the correct project.
* Duplicating a project. Lemons is opened on the view section. The quick edits menu is opened for yuzu, duplicate. The duplicate modal shows that it is lemons that is being dup[licated. If saved, lemons is indeed the one duplicated.
* Deleting a project. Lemons is opened on the view section. The quick edits menu is opened for yuzu, move to trash. The modal does not specify which project is being deleted. Once approved, it is lemons that was deleted instead of lemons.

The quick edits actions should be performed on the project selected, regardless of which one is open on the view section.

*This bug only exists for quick edits on projects.* Task and folder quick edits ok.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Projects] - Intermittent Bugs
description:
Some bugs occasionally appear even after fixes (from first report). The causes of these bugs are still under investigation, thus this issue serves as a monitor for the following bugs:

# Deleting a project you are currently viewing redirects the user to the 1st time visitor (create a project) page even if there are still other projects in the panel. If there are still other projects, the expected behavior would be that the current view will switch to the top listed project on the projects center panel. Only when no other projects exist will the page redirect to the landing page.
# Some actions do not immediately reflect on the projects center panel.
Actions such as: delete, move to folder and duplicate. 
These actions are done successfully but they do not immediately reflecty on the left panel. For example, when a user deletes a project, the success message appears but the project is still listed on the left panel. Only after a page reload will the project disappear.
This was a previous issue and is known to have been fixed, however they still occasionally happen. 

Please help in identifying the cause and consistently replicate the bug.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - GC members who left the group cannot be added back
description:
Description:

Members of a group chat may choose to leave the group, or an admin may remove them. Once removed, the member loses access to the group chat and may not see, send, or receive messages from the group chat. however, the removed member may be added once again to return their access. 
Currently however, the admin cannot re-add the removed member. The admin can see the user’s name on the ‘Add People’ modal, but after clicking on the ‘Add’ button, the button is disabled (turnss to ‘Added’ and becomes gray) but the member is not added back. There is no message notification that the member has been added back.

!qwWNGWtvnc.mp4|width=3840,height=1004!

Also shown above, the admin has successfully added a new user as a GC member, meaning the issue lies with members who left or are removed.

Any member should be able to be added back.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Rich text messages issues
description:
Here is a compilations on some of the issues relating to how rich-text messages are being formatted when sent.

# *Lists*
Ordered and Unordered lists are aligned weirdly. The items are right aligned but the bullets/numbers are left aligned. The issue becomes very visible as the length of the text box increases (like if there are very long texts included outside of the list)
!image-20230330-053419.png|width=581,height=605!
# *Font Size*
Text set to small or large don not appear to be any different to normal size when sent
!image-20230330-053723.png|width=590,height=318!
Additionally, there are two ‘normal’ options. I assume the 2nd ‘normal’ option is x-large?
!image-20230330-053811.png|width=21.576319543509275%!
# *Quotes*
Applying the blockquote format in rich text, I expected something like:
!image-20230330-054458.png|width=634,height=167!
However, the messages is just slightly aligned left with no other visual differences compared to normal text
!image-20230330-054602.png|width=593,height=406!
# *Code Snippet*
There seems to be no formatting whatsoever for code snippets. They are not separated in code blocks, nor is the font different (usually monospace)
!image-20230330-055127.png|width=580,height=416!
# *Text Alignment*
The text alignment does not work at all. 
!image-20230330-055359.png|width=578,height=434!
# *Indentation*
Similar to alignment, there is no indentation.
!image-20230330-055555.png|width=583,height=447!

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][My Projects] - Deleting the project you are currently viewing
description:
Description:

Whenever the user clicks on a project on the projects center panel, the user is able to view the contents of the project (overview, list, kanban etc.). However, you may still delete the project while currently viewing it. Currently, deleting a project you are currently viewing causes some errors to pop up.

Actual:

!chrome_xOzEppZpUl.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

The errors do not show up immediately, not until you refresh the page.

!image-20230329-092552.png|width=379,height=546!



Expected:

If within any view, what should happen if you delete the project you are currently viewing?

There is a couple of scenarios to account for

# The user may delete the currently viewed project, then the view jumps to the nearest project on the list (or the top project on the list, whatever’s better for UX)

But what if there are no other projects?
# Once the last project is deleted, the user is brought back to the landing page (create a project from scratch or template page). 
Or this could be the default action for any project deletion if you are currently viewing it. But it would be better UX to follow option 1 first.

Credentials
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]

If the console is not open, it would not be strange for the user to think that nothing is happening.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - User should not be able to receive/see messages from blocked users
description:
Description:

From the requirement:

!image-20230328-080546.png|width=737,height=160!

The user may still see the chat (previous messages) while in the blocked chats chat list. However, although the blocked user may still send messaged, the blocker should not receive new messages while the other user is blocked. The blocker cannot send messages to the blocked user.

If the blocked user is unblocked, the blocker can now send messages again to the blocked user. All the messages sent by the blocked user (but not received by the blocker) should be restored and can now be seen by the blocker. The blocker and blocked user can now also resume sending and receiving messages.

Actual:

!chrome_FpyKdTllMh.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

In this recording, the blocker is viewing the blocked chat (via the blocked chats list), and they can still see the sent messages in real time. This should not happen.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Switching between chat conversation is slow
description:
!chrome_2aQrzQoQG2.mp4|width=1246,height=648!

Every time the user switches to a different chat conversation, there is a small loading time before the messages show up. If a user constantly switches between conversation, it would feel slow and generally not a great UX.

Compare this to how skype handles switching

!chrome_zvJeAelcR5.mp4|width=1920,height=1006!

overall it feels smoother.



The suggestion would be to pre-load a set amount of messages for the chats available on the left panel, then just fetch more past messages as the user scrolls to them.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Chat] - Unable to send messages
description:
Description:

(Post Bug Fix). User is unable to send messages through chat. There are two scenarios where this happens.

+*Sending a message to an existing chat*+

Trying to send a message to an existing chat does nothing and an error pops up.

!send on existing.mp4|width=1920,height=1008!



+*Creating a new chat and sending a message via template or typing*+

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][My Project] - Error occurs when adding a project to a folder
description:
Description:

The user can create a folder no problem. After reloading, the folder is still in the left panel. A problem however occurs when the user adds a project to a folder.

!chrome_aEMTO7gHL0.gif|width=1920,height=1078!

First, the user can add a project to a folder, but there is no confirmation that the project has been added to the folder although the project has disappeared from the left panel. Expanding the folder reveals that it is still empty.

Second, when you reload the page after “adding a project to a folder”, the folder disappears along with the project. Now both the project and the folder are nowhere to be seen.

Finally, once you have made a project and folder disappear, the user can no longer create any more folders. The user make may new folders and they will show up in the left panel, but reloading the page will make them disappear again (along with added projects if you did so). After reload, an error message “Uh oh, something went wrong” appears.

Checking the console reveals this:

!image-20230308-072829.png|width=601,height=75!

!image-20230308-072907.png|width=1086,height=138!



*note: if you manage to replicate this on a fresh user, the user will be unable to retain folders any more. You need to retest on another account.

*-**Also, there seems to be unusual activity in the console. Please see comment-*

summary: [HOTFIX][STAGING][Desktop][My Requests] - Incorrect Date Filed for requests
description:
HR Hub home displays the local time however the server is actually in UTC. This means that (for those in the Philippines), the local time is 8 hours ahead of the server. The problem however lies in the recorded dates of the requests. For the following example, a request was made at 7:33am Feb 07 2023, but for the server, it was still 11:33pm Feb 06 2023, hence the Date Filed value of the request was recorded as Feb 6.

!chrome_7e0dWLbtMi.gif|width=1920,height=1007!

If there is already support for local time conversion in the HR Hub home, then it should be applied everywhere else in the site in order to keep the consistency between time zones.

Although the example was shown using Schedule requests, this issue possibly also exists anywhere there is a time and date logs like leave requests, employee record change history, projects etc.

For Time Adjustment, the Requested Adjustment Time in and Time Out must be different from the current actual time in and time out for the selected date. For Breaktime Adjustment the Requested Adjustment Time in and Time Out must be different from the current actual start and end of break for the selected date.

Currently, the request is still being sent for approval even if the requested schedule does not differ from the current schedules.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][HR Hub] - Failure to detect if a duplicate request is sent if the date falls within the date range of another request
description:
Description:

The general rule is: the user cannot make a request of the same type for a date if there already exists another request for that date. A change of Schedule request may deal with a change of schedule for a single day, or it could be for a range of dates.

For the scenario dealing with single day requests, there is no problem detecting duplicate requests. I.E. a user requests to change their schedule for Feb 14 from 8AM-5PM to 10AM-7pm, then they tried to submit another request for the same day (Feb 14). Regardless of the time for the new request, it is being detected that there already exists another request for the same day. This is expected behavior.

The problem lies when a date range is involved. 

Consider the ff. example:

!image-20230202-091133.png|width=1052,height=213!

The first request (top) is for a change of schedule for Feb 2- Feb 6. Then the second request (bottom) is for a change of schedule for Feb 3. As we can see, Feb 3 falls between the range of Feb 2-6, but both these requests are listed as pending.

As long as any date within any two or more requests coincide with each other, the request cannot be sent for approval. Not unless the user deletes the first request.

Credentials
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link] 
user: [sean+test@offshorly.com|mailto:sean+test@offshorly.com] // seanKnit1!

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to url and login with the user account.
# Hover over HR Hub in the navigation menu (left), then click 'My Requests'
# Select ‘Change of Schedule’
# Select any date change, fulfill the required fields, then send for approval
# Open the ‘Pending Requests’ page to confirm that the request has been submitted
# Send another ‘Change of Schedule’ request, but this time, select a single date that falls within the date range of the first request. Send for approval
# Open the ‘Pending Requests’ page, take note if both requests appear on the list

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Projects] - Left Panel, Names Corrections
description:
*Project and Folder Names*

According to the requirement updates, the project and folder names should have a character limit of 60 characters, however there are still scenarios that the name is too long to fit on the left panel list.

There are two scenarios for this.

# The name is too long, but there are spaces within the name
# The name is one long string of characters, without spaces

!image-20230126-073253.png|width=311,height=460!

As you can see, if the name includes multiple spaces (Lorem ipsum …), the whole text is fully displayed in the left panel. This causes the name to take a great amount of vertical space. 

If the name then is one long string of characters, the name is cutoff.



For scenario one, the fix should be that the name should be limited to only one line in the next panel, and is cutoff similarly to that of scenario two. This makes sure that the height of all projects and folder names are uniform.

Next, as per the [requirement |https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KNIT/pages/2080112641/Folder+Options]

{quote}If the name is too long, ellipses will appear to show that there’s more to the name, so the user can hover over it (as mentioned) in order to view the whole name.{quote}

Meaning that in the left panel, there should be an ellipses in the project/folder name before it is cut off. Then, if the user hovers over these long names, the full name should appear on some kind of hover text.

This applies for all in the left panel, folders, projects, tasks, or dashboard etc. As long as they appear in the left panel.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Attendance] - Excess and Deficit Calculation updates
description:
Description:

Recent requirements updates require changes in the calculations of *Excess* and *Deficit* in the attendance table.



*Excess*

Currently, the excess is being calculated as 

{quote}Excess = Actual Time Out - Schedule Time Out{quote}

!image-20230124-032304.png|width=1292,height=71!

*Notice that in this sample, the user timed in early (09:11 for a 10:00 sched) and timed out on time, but the excess is 00:00.

Excess should also +take into account Early Time Ins+. For example, a user with a schedule of 8am-5pm, times in at 7am and times out at 6pm. The calculated Excess should be 2hrs since they were early for 1hr and worked late for another 1hr.



*Deficit*

Current deficit amount is determined by either late, undertime, or both. But currently, there are scenarios where the deficit is being offset by extra work time.

!image-20230124-032740.png|width=1287,height=133!

*Notice in this sample, the user is late by around 2hrs but worked around 2hrs past their scheduled Time Out. The deficit then calculated is 00:01. 

The deficit is a record of the user’s lateness and undertime, therefore the deficit should not be offset by extra time worked.

For scenarios like

{quote}Early Time In, Early Time Out (Undertime)

Late Time In, Late Time Out{quote}

The deficit should still only include late or undertime.



Credentials
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Attendance] - Undertime is wrongly calculated when the timeout is past midnight
description:
Description:

See this specific example.

!image-20230113-032607.png|width=1232,height=491!

The user has a schedule of 02:00AM-18:00PM. the user Timed IN at 08:00 am (early, but ignore for now), Jan 10. Then the user Timed Out at 00:59 am, Jan 11 (very early, technically next day). But the time calculations did not seem to consider the date, so the time out was possibly registered as 00:59 am, Jan 10. Hence, the UT was calculated as 18:00 pm (scheduled time out for jan 10) - 00:59 am, which is around 17:00 hrs UnderTime. 

But the correct record would have the user with no UT, and around 7hrs excess.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Employee Record: Edit] - Lower educational attainments should also appear
description:

!chrome_F8Rjlgephs.gif|width=1628,height=844!

Notice how when an educational attainment is selected, only the fields for that educational attainment appear.



Expected:

* When High School is selected, the High School fields should appear.
* When College is selected, the College Degree, Additional College Degree and High School fields should appear.
* When Master’s is selected, the Master’s Degree, Additional Master’s Degree, High School, College, and Additional College Degree fields should appear.
* When Doctorate is selected, the Doctorate Degree, Additional Doctorate Degree, High School, College, Additional College Degree, Master’s Degree, Additional Master’s Degree fields should appear.

summary: [STAGING][Desktop][Employee Record: Documents] - User is unable to reupload a deleted attachment
description:
Description:

There are scenarios that makes the user unable to reupload a recently deleted attachment.

* User uploads a file, then deletes it before submission. If the user tries to reupload the same file, it does not show up in the ‘Browse File’ field.

!chrome_sI1S5GEiAP.gif|width=1917,height=1007!

* User uploads a file, submits it, then deletes the file. If the user tries to reupload the same file, it does not show up in the ‘Browse File’ field.

!21FrUn7Ese.gif|width=1916,height=1006!

On both these scenarios, the user will only be able to reupload the same file by reloading the page or first uploading a different file then reuploading the original file.



For a smoother user experience, although the scenario may be rarely encountered, this should be fixed.



Credentials
URL: [https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/|smart-link]

summary: [STAGING][HR Hub] - Page layout corrections: Top and Bottom Padding
description:
Here are some improvements that could be done for the page layout of the HR hub pages.

+*Right padding between the content and the white box*+

summary: Unable to Log out from Knit
description:
Environment: Staging/Dev environment

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to [Knit Project Management and Collaboration Tool (idealforliving.com)|https://play.idealforliving.com/hr-hub/employees/dashboard]

2. Click Log out

Actual: User cannot log out from the system

Expected: User should be able to log out

*Dev UPD*: It is needed to update authMiddleware to check if token is valid on page initialization, If token is invalid, we need to clear current authToken in storage and go to login page.
Also we should Implement error handler for all request, if we get ‘Invalid token’, then do the same - clear current authToken in storage and go to login page.

+So for QA+: When we get ‘Invalid token’ error on BE request, the toast “session expired” should appear and app should redirect us to login page.
1) Checking token appears when we refresh the page. When token has been checked once and it is correct, navigation through site should work without token checking. But on refreshing page token will be checked.
2) ‘Invalid token’ error is handled on each BE request. So if we navigate (as mentioned in (1)) to page that have BE requests and token is incorrect, the app will show toast and redirect to login page
3) Check video in comments. Also, to get this error simply, you can go to DevTools → Application → Local Storage → “[https://play.idealforliving.com/|https://play.idealforliving.com/]” and change authToken variable.
If you have any questions, dm [~accountid:62e8ae4ad49df231b6273d64] in Skype

  "reason": "string"
}

The leaves taken parameter is 2. 

*Expected Result:*
The leaves taken parameter should be 1.

summary: [STAGING][DESKTOP][LOGIN] - Unable to log in using registered email
description:
*URL*: [https://play.idealforliving.com/login|https://play.idealforliving.com/login|smart-link]

*Description*: Under certain conditions, the user is unable to log in to knit using an email address that is connected to a registered email account

*Credentials:*
username: [knituser1@mailinator.com|mailto:knituser1@mailinator.com]
password: Password1.

*Steps to replicate:*

# Go to URL
# Enter a registered email address
# Click on 'Next'

*Actual result:*
The error message “We couldn't find this username. Sign up now.“ appears.

Screenshot of page: [https://i.imgur.com/m7Le40l.png|https://i.imgur.com/m7Le40l.png|smart-link]
Screenshot with console log: [https://i.imgur.com/smrowwy.png|https://i.imgur.com/smrowwy.png|smart-link] [https://i.imgur.com/oOOu9yr.png|https://i.imgur.com/oOOu9yr.png|smart-link]

*Expected Result:*
After clicking 'Next', the password field should appear.
The user should be able enter their password in order to log in and should be redirected to the landing page afterwards. 

*ADDITIONAL NOTES*
Some fixes the QA has tried in order to replicate/solve the issue:

* clear cache, history, and other browser data ({color:#bf2600}_issue appears_{color})
* create and use another browser profile ({color:#bf2600}_issue appears_{color})
* use other browsers on the same device ({color:#bf2600}_issue appears_{color})
* use private mode/ incognito mode ({color:#bf2600}_issue appears_{color})
* use another device connected to the same network ({color:#bf2600}_issue appears_{color})
* create another browser profile ({color:#bf2600}_issue appears_{color})
* connect to another network ({color:#36b37e}_issue does not appear_{color})
* use another device and connect to a non-PLDT ISP ({color:#36b37e}_issue does not appear_{color})

It seems that the issue can only be replicated under certain specific conditions. Under the list below are conditions that I have found where the issue appears:

* opening the site while being connected to an SSID that is under a PLDT Home Fiber subscription
* (more items to be added as more conditions are discovered)

*More screenshots*

using other devices connected to PLDT: [https://i.imgur.com/oOOu9yr.png|https://i.imgur.com/oOOu9yr.png|smart-link] [https://i.imgur.com/vwxv4Rd.png|https://i.imgur.com/vwxv4Rd.png|smart-link] [https://i.imgur.com/iZVY7qB.png|https://i.imgur.com/iZVY7qB.png|smart-link] 
using other devices not connected to PLDT: [https://i.imgur.com/NerJSm0.png|https://i.imgur.com/NerJSm0.png|smart-link][https://i.imgur.com/6PGp6aR.png|https://i.imgur.com/6PGp6aR.png|smart-link]

description:
URL: [http://play.idealforliving.com/signup|http://play.idealforliving.com/signup]

*Description*: The 'Sign up with Google' and 'Sign up with Facebook' buttons are not working

*Steps to replicate:*

# Go to URL
# Click on 'Sign up with Google'
# Click on 'Sign up with Facebook'

*Actual result:*
Nothing happens, the user stays in the Sign Up page.
[https://i.imgur.com/tunquIw.gif|https://i.imgur.com/tunquIw.gif|smart-link] 

*Expected Result:*
Clicking on 'Sign up with Google' should take the user to the Google Sign In page.
Clicking on 'Sign up with Facebook' should take the user to the Facebook Sign In page.

summary: [STAGING][DESKTOP][SIGNUP] - Sign up/Log in via SSO buttons should be changed to 'Continue with...'
description:
URL: [http://play.idealforliving.com/signup|http://play.idealforliving.com/signup] and [http://play.idealforliving.com/login|http://play.idealforliving.com/login]



*Description*: In the Sign Up and Log in pages, the buttons for signing up and logging  in via SSO should be labeled as ‘Continue with…'

*Steps to replicate:*

# Go to URL
# Pay attention to the Google and Facebook  Sign Up and Log In buttons

*Actual result:*
In both pages, the buttons are labeled as ‘Log in with Google' and 'Log in with Facebook’.
Screenshot : [https://i.imgur.com/pN87NVR.png|https://i.imgur.com/pN87NVR.png|smart-link] 

*Expected Result:*
In both pages, the buttons should be labeled as ‘Continue with Google' and 'Continue with Facebook’.

summary: [STAGING][DESKTOP][SIGNUP & LOGIN] - User is unable to modify the email in the field
description:
URL: [http://play.idealforliving.com/signup|http://play.idealforliving.com/signup] and [http://play.idealforliving.com/login|http://play.idealforliving.com/login]

*Description*: After filling up the username field and then clicking next, the user is unable to modify the email they entered.

*Steps to replicate:*

# Go to URL
# Enter a valid email address in the email field, then click next.
# Click on the email address field again and try to modify the text inside the field.

*Actual result:*
The user cannot click on or modify the email address field. In order to change the text, they would need to click on the 'back' button in their browser.

[https://i.imgur.com/BckFptn.gif|https://i.imgur.com/BckFptn.gif|smart-link] 



*Expected Result:*
There should be a way for the user to change the email address without needing to click the 'back' button in the browser.

summary: [STAGING][DESKTOP][SIGNUP] - Email Verification link does not expire after 10 minutes
description:
URL: [http://play.idealforliving.com/signup|http://play.idealforliving.com/signup]

*Description*: The user receives an a link to verify their email after signing up. The link does not expire after 10 minutes.

*Steps to replicate:*

# Go to URL
# Enter a valid email address in the email field, then click next.
# Enter a valid password, then tick the Terms and Conditions. Answer the captcha.
# Click submit. User should be taken to the next page.
# In the user’s email inbox, there should be an email containing a link to verify the account.
# Ignore the link and wait for 10 minutes.
# After 10 minutes, click the link.

*Actual result:*
The user is taken to the Knit site.

*Expected Result:*
The user should not be taken to the Knit site after clicking the link. The link should have expired after 10 minutes.

summary: [STAGING][DESKTOP][SIGNUP] - Password Strength is not indicated
description:
Devices: Desktop
OS: Windows
Browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Edge

URL: [http://play.idealforliving.com/signup|http://play.idealforliving.com/signup]

*Description*: When signing up using email, as the user types in the password field, the password strength is not indicated below the field.

*Steps to replicate:*

# Go to URL
# Enter a valid email address  in the email field, then click next.
# Click on the Password field.
# Enter (and erase )a varying number of characters into the field and pay attention to the area around it. 

*Actual result:*
Only the message “8 characters minimum.“ is displayed below the field when entering less than 8 characters.

[https://i.imgur.com/Cz5uhz8.gif|https://i.imgur.com/Cz5uhz8.gif|smart-link] 



*Expected Result:*
”Very weak password” should be displayed at 1-5 characters

”Weak password” should be displayed at 7 characters

”Strong password” should be displayed at 8 characters

”Very strong password” should be displayed at 9 or more characters

summary: Create Dashboard - Folder drop-down retains last selected option
description:
Issue: In the Create Dashboard dialog box, the Folder drop-down list retains the last option you’ve selected.

For example, in the last dashboard creation, I selected Create new folder and created one. When you click Create Dashboard again, The Folder field’s drop-down list will show Create new folder instead of the default None.

*1st Sample:*

Last created dashboard:

!image-20220426-111047.png|width=1628,height=946!

Succeeding view of Create Dashboard:

Folder still shows Create new folder.

!image-20220426-111131.png|width=1650,height=921!



*2nd Sample:*

Last created Dashboard where Folder is none:

!image-20220426-111231.png|width=682,height=554!

Succeeding creation of dashboard shows None on the Folder field:

!image-20220426-111314.png|width=1598,height=916!

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit staging site
# Click Dashboard.
# Create Dashboard by clicking  +
# Select Blank Dashboard
# Type Dashboard Name
# Select Folder as Create New Folder
# Add Folder Name
# Click Create Dashboard
# Create another dashboard. Click +
# Select Blank Dashboard
# Check default value on the Folder field

*Expected*: Folder field’s default value is None.

*Actual*: Folder’s field’s default value changes based on the last folder option selected. See sample screenshots above.
status: For Smoke Testing in Dev Env

summary: Dashboard Created with missing confirmation message of created Dashboard
description:
Creating 2nd dashboard takes time. Start time: 11:21 AM as as shown below. 2nd Dashboard still not created as of 11:50 AM. But when you hit back, it’s already created.

!image-20220404-032256.png|width=50%!

!image-20220404-033623.png|width=50%!

!image-20220404-035101.png|width=50%!

[^Knit Dashboard - PageSpeed Insights.pdf]

User: [milettedecastro@gmail.com|mailto:milettedecastro@gmail.com]

Environment: Staging

Steps to Replicate:

# Log in to Knit.
# Create 1 dashboard in a new folder.
# Create 2nd dashboard in a new folder.

Expected result: 2nd dashboard will be created fast, less than a second or 2 seconds.

Actual Result: 2nd dashboard is still not created after 30 minutes and more; but when you click Back, the dashboards are created. 

The page just keeps on showing the 3 dots that it’s loading; so you won’t know that the board was already created until you click Back and check.

----

To add, there are still few times that the page takes longer to create a new dashboard. Please help to check. Thanks.



!image-20220412-112139.png|width=1496,height=864!

status: For QA Testing in Dev Env

summary: Tickets - Resizing browser window - distorts view
description:
Issue: Placement of images and texts are not fixed and look distorted when resizing the window (i.e. click Restore)

!image-20220404-100959.png|width=886,height=530!

Steps to Replicate:

# Register a user with its First Name starting with Admin
# Log in to Knit site
# Go to Knit Tickets
# Resize the window, meaning click Restore on the browser window

Expected Result: Images would still display well. A portion of the image will be shown. As an example, restore the browser home page of Microsoft Edge.

Actual Result:

The text for Back and Next exceeds the size of the button

The sheep is also moving out of its border. See screenshot.

Expected result:

The display of the screen when resized would still be organized and would still retain readable. Images are intact and don’t float away from the button placement.



Suggestions:

Option 1: Display 1/4 of the screen only and have a vertical & horizontal scrollbar.

Here are samples from resized windows for Sourcefit and Jira. 

!image-20220405-012255.png|width=961,height=526!

!image-20220405-012427.png|width=962,height=525!

Option 2: Adjust the image for the Back and Next buttons to fit in the button border. Show the Create Queue and Create Ticket Form in one row, then Submit Ticket and Go to My Tickets on another row.

!image-20220405-093612.png|width=964,height=529!

summary: Enhancement: Strengthen Password Validation
description:
Weak passwords like names are allowed. The only requirement for password is the 8-character length.

It doesn’t require at least 1 special character, 1 number and 1 in upper case for a stronger and more secure password.

Ex. For User Milette, milettedec passed the security validation.

!image-20220119-072455.png|width=427,height=699!

Steps to Replicate:

# Go to login page
# Click Sign up
# Register your email address
# Click Continue to confirm sign up
# Log out
# Log in with registered email address
# Complete your account details popup window will appear
# Enter a weak password. 
# Click Continue

Scenario applies to all screens where password is required to be created.



Actual result: Weak passwords like names are allowed. The only requirement for password is the 8-character length.

It doesn’t require at least 1 special character, 1 number and 1 in upper case for a stronger and more secure password.

Ex. For User Milette, milettedec passed the security validation.



Expected result: Warning message about weak password and how to strengthen it should appear.

The user who is redirected to complete registration will always have partial registration. This error message can be removed then.

# Login using an existing user who logged in for the 1st time or someone who hasn’t completed entering details upon registration

# Click Sign Up/Continue

“Only partial registrations can be finalized.”

This could mean that the user already has a complete registration; but this is not the case. 



Expected result: No warning message should appear.

The user who is redirected to complete registration will always have partial registration. This error message can be removed then.



Thoughts?

See [Forgot Password - KnitWare - Confluence (atlassian.net)|https://sourcefitdev.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KNIT/pages/2024210737/Forgot+Password]

summary: No error message for mismatch on Confirm Password
description:
on Complete account sign up popup window,

when you enter another password that doesn’t match the password used, 

there’s no error message that appears. 

!image-20220118-034322.png|width=686,height=956!



Steps to Replicate:

# Go to login page
# Click Sign up
# Register your email address
# Click Continue to confirm sign up
# Log out
# Log in with registered email address
# Complete your account details popup window will appear
# Enter a different password on the Confirm Password field

Actual result: when you enter another password that doesn’t match the password used, 

there’s no error message that appears. 

Expected Result: Error message about the password mismatch should appear

summary: No field validation when Full Name only contains first Name
description:
On Complete Account popup’s Full Name field, even if the user enters only his/her first name or last name, there’s no validation that it’s incomplete. It could be better to separate the text fields for First Name and Last Name.

!image-20220118-033955.png|width=649,height=962!

Steps to Replicate:

# Go to login page
# Click Sign up
# Register your email address
# Click Continue to confirm sign up
# Log out
# Log in with registered email address
# Complete your account details popup window will appear
# On the Full Name field, Enter first name only

9. Click Continue



Actual result:

No error message appear for name not entered in full

Expected Result: Error message about incomplete full  name should appear

summary: Complete Account popup page is cut off
description:
Complete your account details popup window is shown as cut off. The rounded borders at the bottom don’t appear. No continue or Complete Sign up button appears to continue. See attached



Steps to Replicate:

# Go to login page
# Click Sign up
# Register your email address
# Click Continue to confirm sign up
# Log out
# Log in with registered email address
# Complete your account details popup window will appear
# Scroll down to view the full window

 

Actual Result: Complete your account details popup window is shown as cut off. The rounded borders at the bottom don’t appear. No continue or Complete Sign up button appears to continue. See attached



Expected Result: Complete your account details popup window should not be cut off.

summary: Email Address on header extends past right navigation
description:
The email address on header shows past the border. It extends up to the right navigation. See attached.

# Go to login page
# Click Sign up
# Register with long email address, ex. miletteddecastro@gmail.com
# Look at the username on the header

 

Actual Result: The email address/username on header shows past the border. It extends up to the right pane. See attached.

Expected Result: The email address/username on header should only appear within the border of the middle/main body.

summary: No Email Verification upon Sign Up
description:

# Sign up as new user, ex. miletteddecastro@gmail.com
# Click Sign up.
# Check mailbox for email verification

Expected Result: personal email address used for sign up will receive an email verification

Actual result: personal email address used for sign up did not receive any email.

summary: Buttons not visible in complete your account details when zoomed at 100% - Addressed in KNT-1453
description:
Complete account details popup box is unscrollable when the browser zoom setting is at 100% thus sign-up and cancel buttons are not visible

!image-20211125-060248.png|width=1449,height=746!



Buttons are visible only when the screen is zoomed out at 80% 

!image-20211125-060209.png|width=1458,height=753!



*Acceptance Criteria:*
1. Buttons should be visible at initial view (Responsive web design)

2. Complete account detail box should be scrollable when the view does not fit in the user’s screen
